Elemental analysis for 3: [In(OH)(FeC12H8O4)]: calc. C 35.7%, H 2.3%; found C 36.3%, H 2.4%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Optimized Synthesis of CAU-45: 446.4 mg (2.00 mmol) 5-acetamidoisophthalic acid and 17 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE lined steel autoclave. Afterwards 0.892 mL (2.13 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid were added and the autoclave was sealed. The mixture was heated to 160 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 22 hours. After the reaction mixture was slowly cooled down to room temperature over 24 h, 525.1 mg of a pale ocher solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent drying for 4 hours at 50 °C (yield: 92 %, based on zirconium and the composition [Zr30O20(OH)26(OAc)18L18]). The real yield will be smaller due to impurities and guest molecules in the pores.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.1 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-10-OCH3. Ga-CAU-10-OCH3 was synthesized under microwave-assisted heating in a 20 ml glass reactor starting from a mixture of 1.5 mL of a 0.72 mol/l aqueous gallium nitrate solution (1.1 mmol), 124.5 mg (0.64 mmol) 5-methoxyisophthalic acid, 13.5 ml toluene and 0.65 ml of a 2 mol/l aqueous NaOH (13 mmol). This mixture was heated at 140 °C for 3 h. After cooling to room temperature the microcrystalline product was isolated by vacuum filtration, washed with 50 ml N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) and stirred in 15 ml water for 24 h to remove impurities. [Ga(OH)(C9H6O5)] · H2O, C = 36.0 % (calcd 36.2 %) and H = 2.9 % (calcd 3.0 %). Yield: 58.2 mg (18.7 % based on Ga3+).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:During the synthesis optimization, it was possible to isolate single crystals under the following conditions: Ga-CAU-10-OCH3 single crystals were synthesized under conventional heating in a miniaturized 2 ml Teflon reactor starting from a mixture of 0.05 ml of a 0.72 mol/l aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.036 mmol), 8.3 mg 5-methoxyisophthalic acid (0.64 mmol), 0.88 ml toluene and 0.07 ml of a 2 mol/l aqueous NaOH (0.14 mmol). The mixture was heated to 120 °C within 1 h, the temperature was kept for 12 h and cooled down within 6 h to room temperature. The single crystals are shown in Figure S3 of the following section.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.3 Synthesis of Al-CAU-10-NHCOCH3. Al-CAU-10-NHCOCH3 was synthesized under conventional heating in a 20 ml Teflon reactor from a mixture of 0.5 ml of a 1 mol/l aqueous aluminum nitrate solution (0.5 mmol), 223.0 mg 5-acetamideisophthalic acid (0.1 mmol), 9 ml water and 0.5 ml DMF. This mixture was heated at 160 °C for 48 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by centrifugation, washed with 10 ml DMF and stirred in 10 ml water for 24 h to remove impurities. The final product was dried for 24 h at 80 °C under atmospheric conditions. [Al(OH)(C10O5H7N)], C = 44.2 % (calcd 45.3 %), H = 3.7 %(calcd 3.0 %), and N = 6.1 % (calcd 5.3 %). Yield: 67.3 mg (50.8 % based on Al3+).A pH value of pH=3 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.4 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-10-NHCOCH3. Ga-CAU-10-NHCOCH3 was synthesized under microwave-assisted heating in a 20 ml glass reactor from a mixture of an aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 1.0 ml 0.72 mmol), 5-acetamideisophthalic acid (220.4 mg, 0.1 mmol), water (18.6 ml) and NaOH (2 mol/l, 0.4 ml, 0.8mmol). This mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by centrifugation and washed once with 20 ml DMF and twice with ethanol. The final product was dried for 72 h at 80 °C at atmospheric conditions. [Ga(OH)(C10O5H7N)], C = 37.3 % (calcd 38.0 %), H = 2.6 % (calcd 2.9 %) and N = 4.5 % (calcd 4.6 %). Yield: 112 mg (75 % based on Ga3+).A pH value of pH=5 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.5 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-11A typical reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.9 ml, 0.65 mmol), H2SDBS (186 mg, 0.6 mmol) and water (9.1 ml). All materials were placed in a 20 ml glass reactor and heated at 120 °C for 2 h in a microwave oven. After cooling to room temperature and vacuum filtration the white powder was stirred for 2 h in 15 ml DMF, vacuum filtrated, washed with 50 ml ethanol and dried at 160 °C. [Ga(OH)(C14H8O6S)], C = 42.6 % (calcd 43.0 %), H = 2.5 % (calcd 2.3 %) and S = 8.6 % (calcd 8.2 %). Yield: 65.4 mg (26.0 % based on Ga3+).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.6 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-11-COOH. Ga-CAU-11-COOH was synthesized in a 20 ml Teflon reactor starting from a reaction mixture which contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.5 ml, 0.36 mmol), DPSTC (179.1 mg, 0.5 mmol), water (8.75 ml), NaOH (2 mol/l, 0.65 ml, 1.3 mmol) and concentrated acetic acid (0.5 ml, 8.7mmol). The reactor was placed in a steel autoclave and heated in a ventilation oven at 180 °C for 24 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by filtration and washed with 50 ml of N,N'-DMF, 50 ml of ethanol and dried for 2 h at 80 °C. [Ga(OH)(C16H8O10S)], C = 39.6 % (calcd 40.1 %), H = 1.9 % (calcd 1.9 %) and S = 6.7 % (calcd 6.7 %). Yield: 135 mg (77.0 % based on Ga3+).The pH value of the reaction mixture changed from pH = 5 to pH = 3 during the reaction.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.7 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-49. Ga-CAU-49 was obtained in miniaturized 2 ml Teflon reactors. A reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.1 ml, 0.07 mmol), 5-metylisophthlaic acid (9.1 mg, 0.05 mmol), toluene (0.425 ml), water (0.425 ml) and acetic acid (4 mol/l, 0.05 ml, 0.2 mmol). The reaction was carried out at 120 °C for 24 h. The resulting white solid was filtered off, stirred for 1 h in 15 ml DMF, washed with water and dried at 80 °C. [Ga4(C9H7O4)2(C9H6O4)3(OH)4(H2O)] · 0.5 Ga2O3, C = 41.1 %(calcd 40.0 %) and H = 3.1 % (calcd 2.8 %). 10.2 mg (2 % based on m-BDC-CH32-ions).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.During the synthesis optimization, it was possible to isolate single crystals, which were obtained under the conditions described above.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:2.8 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-51A typical reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.05 ml, 0.036 mmol), 2,5-thiophenedicarboxylic acid (8.6 mg, 0.05 mmol) in 1 ml of a 80:20 vol% solution of concentrated acetic acid and water. All chemicals were placed in a 4 ml glass reactor and heated at 120 °C for 4 h in a microwave oven. The resulting white powder was isolated by centrifugation, treated for 24 h in 4 ml methanol and dried at 80 °C after filtration. [Ga(OH)(C6O4H2S)] · 2 H2O, C = 24.9 % (calcd 24.6 %), H = 1.7 % (calcd 2.4 %) and S = 11.0 % (calcd 11.0 %). Yield: 2.7 mg (22 % based on Ga3+ ions).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Syntheses of the title compounds. The title compounds werefirst synthesized using our high-throughput setup19 by adding 30 μL (0.03 mmol, c = 1 mol L-1) of an aqueous solution of therespective metal nitrate (Al3+, Ga3+ or Fe3+) to a mixture of1,1,2,2-tetrakis(4-phosphonophenyl)ethylene (0.015 mmol,9.8 mg) and 970 μL H2O. After sealing the multiclave, the reac tion was carried out using the temperature-time-program ofheating up to 180 °C within one hour and keeping the reactiontemperature for 12 h at 180 °C. After cooling to room tempera ture, the product was isolated by filtration and rinsed threetimes with 2 mL of water and finally dried under ambient con ditions. All three compounds were obtained as microcrystal line powders.Results of the elemental analyses (observed/calculated):Al-CAU-53, [Al2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·2H2O:C 40.5/40.4, H 3.99/3.39Ga-CAU-53, [Ga2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·2H2O:C 36.7/36.4, H 3.15/3.06Fe-CAU-53, [Fe2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·3H2O:C 36.9/36.8, H 3.53/3.33

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis scale-up of Ga-CAU-53 and Fe-CAU-53. Although ascaled-up synthesis of Al-CAU-53 was not feasible, the follow ing procedure was used to obtain larger amounts of Ga- andFe-CAU-53. Applying the same procedure to the Al-CAU-53 syn thesis, only X-ray amorphous products were obtained.1,1,2,2-Tetrakis(4-phosphonophenyl)-ethylene (0.15 mmol,97.9 mg) and an aqueous solution of gallium nitrate or ironnitrate (0.3 mmol, 300 μL, 1 mol L-1) were added to 9.7 mLwater placed in a 30 mL Teflon insert. The same temperature time-program as described above was used. The precipitatewas filtered off and washed with 15 mL water. In case of Ga CAU-53, 96.8 mg (0.113 mmol, 75.2%) of a white-yellowishpowder was obtained. Fe-CAU-53 was obtained as yellowpowder (100 mg, 0.118 mmol, 78.9%).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:SYNTHESIS OF COMPOUNDSZIF-20: Zn(Pur)2·(DMF)0.75 (H2O)1.5. A solid mixture of zinc nitratetetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (65 mg, 0. 25 mmol, EM Science) and purine(150 mg, 1.25 mmol, Fluka or Sigma) was dissolved in 5 ml DMF (Fisher) in a20 ml vial to obtain a slightly turbid solution. The vial was tightly capped andheated at 65 °C in an isothermal oven for 3 days to yield pale yellow octahedralcrystals along with a small amount of powder. After unassisted cooling of thevial to room temperature, the powder product was removed by decanting withmother liquor and washed three times with DMF (5 ml). The crystals weredried in air for 30 min (yield: 48 mg, 50% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:ZIF-21: Co(Pur)2·(DMF)(H2O). A solid mixture of cobalt(II) nitratehexahydrate Co(NO3)2·6H2O (146 mg, 0.502 mmol, Aldrich) and purine(300 mg, 2.50 mmol) was dissolved in DMF (5 ml) in a 20 ml vial. To thesolution, 2.0 M dimethylamine solution in methanol (1.25 ml, 2.50 mmol,Aldrich) was added. The vial was tightly capped and heated at 85 °C in anisothermal oven for 24 h to yield purple octrahedral crystals. After unassistedcooling of the vial to room temperature, the mother liquor was decanted andthe crystals were rinsed three times with DMF (5 ml) and dried in air for 1 h(yield: 92 mg, 47% based on Co(NO3 )2·6H2O).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:ZIF-22: Zn(5-Azabenzimidazolato)2·(DMF)0.75 (H2O)2. A solid mixture ofzinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (52 mg, 0.20 mmol) and5-azabenzimidazole (238 mg, 2.00 mmol, Aldrich) was dissolved in 2 ml DMFin a 4 ml vial to obtain a white precipitate. The vial was tightly capped andheated at 150 °C in an isothermal oven for 3 days to yield pale yellow octahedralcrystals along with a small amount of powder. After unassisted cooling of thevial to room temperature, the powder product was removed by decanting withmother liquor and rinsed three times with DMF (4 mlx3). The crystals weredried in air for 30 min (yield: 68 mg, 87% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O)

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:ZIF-23: Zn(4-Azabenzimidazolato)2·(H2O)0.25. A solid mixture of zinc nitratetetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (52 mg, 0.20 mmol) and 4-azabenzimidazole(119 mg, 1.00 mmol, Aldrich) was dissolved in 1 ml DMF in a 4 ml vial. The vialwas tightly capped and heated at 100 °C in an isothermal oven for 1 day to yieldpale yellow prism crystals. After unassisted cooling of the vial to roomtemperature, the crystals were rinsed three times with DMF (5 ml) and dried inair for 30 min (yield: 55 mg, 90% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O). The sameproduct was obtained in reactions at different temperatures (65 and 150 °C), atwhich ZIF-20 and ZIF-22 were synthesized, respectively. Reaction with adifferent ligand/metal ratio (1:10, instead of 1:5) as used in the synthesis ofZIF-21 also gave the same compound..

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:(ZIF-2 crb): Zn(IM)2. 0.18 mL imidazole stock solution (0.15 M (1 M = 1 mol dm-3), 2.7 × 10-5 mol) and 0.12 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.15 M, 1.8 × 10-5 mol) were mixed together. After the glass plate was loaded with mixtures of stock solutions dispensed by a programmed liquid handler (Gilson, model 215), it was covered with a PTFE sheet, sealed by fastening the sheet with a metal clamp, then heated in an oven at 85 °C and allowed to react solvothermally for 72 h. The product was in the form of prism-shaped single crystals. The unit cell dimensions of the ZIF thus obtained match with the unit cell dimensions of ZIF-2 previously reported.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:ZIF-25: Zn(C5H7N2)2 = Zn(dmIm)2A solution of zinc acetate Zn(O2CCH3)2 (0.147 g, 0.8 mmol) in 8 mL N,Ndimethylformamideand a solution of 4,5-dimethylimidazole (0.233 g, 2.4 mmol) in 8mL N,N-dimethylformamide was sealed in a 20 mL vial, and heated in an oven at 125 °C, and allowed to react solvothermally for 12 h. The mother liquor was decanted and thecrystalline powder was washed with chloroform (3 x 5 mL). The product was activatedwith chloroform (3 x 10 mL) over three days before drying under vacuum (0.01 Torr) for24 h at 80 °C. Yield: 0.0269 g, 76% based on 4,5-dimethylimidazole.

The product wasactivated with chloroform (3 x 10 mL) over three days before drying under vacuum (0.01Torr) for 24 h at 80 °C. Yield: 0.0183 g, 68% based on 4,5-dichloroimidazole.

Yield: 0.0191 g, 84% based on 4-methylimidazole-5-carbaldehyde.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:ZIF-96: Zn(C4H3N4)2 = Zn(4cy5amIm)2A solution of zinc acetate (Zn(O2CCH3)2) (0.147 g, 0.8 mmol) in 8 mL of N,Ndimethylformamideand a solution of 4-aminoimidazole-5-carbonitrile (0.2592 g, 2.4mmol) in 8 mL N,N-dimethylformamide were combined and sealed in a 20 mL vial,heated in an oven at 85 °C, and allowed to react solvothermally for 12 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Bulk scale synthesis of (ZIF-78 gme): Zn(nIm)(nbIm). 5 mL 2-nitroimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) and 5 mL 5-nitro benzimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) were mixed in a 20 mL vial. To this solution was added 4 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.20 M). The vial was capped and heated to 100 °C for 96 h. The mother liquor was decanted and the precipitate was washed with DMF (15 mL) three times. Yellow crystals of ZIF-78 were collected by filtration and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.060 g, 28%).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Bulk scale synthesis of (ZIF-79 gme): Zn(nIm)(mbIm). 5 mL 2-nitroimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) and 5 mL 5-methylbenzimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) were mixed in a 20 mL vial. To this solution was added 4 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.20 M). The vial was capped and heated to 85 °C for 96 h. The mother liquor was decanted and the products were washed with DMF (15 mL) three times. Yellow crystals of ZIF-79 were collected by filtration and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.030 g, 14%)

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Solvothermal procedureSingle crystals of ZIF-90 were obtained by heating a solution of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate (Zn(NO3)2·4H2O) (0.054 g, 0.21 mmol) and imidazole-2-carboxyaldehyde (0.029 g, 0.30 mmol) in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF, 3 mL) for 18 h at 100 °C.Vapor diffusionZinc nitrate tetrahydrate (Zn(NO3)2·4H2O) (0.13 g, 0.50 mmol) and imidazole-2-carboxyaldehyde (0.07 g, 0.75 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) was placed in a desiccator under an atmosphere of triethylamine (5 mL) in hexane (200 mL). The reaction was allowed to sit at room temperature for 24 h. The crystalline powder obtained was filtered and washed with methanol (3 x 5 mL). The product was activated with methanol (3 x 10 mL) over a three-day period before being dried under vacuum (10-2 Torr) for 24 h at room temperature. Yield (0.08 g, 61.5%) CHN calculated for C8H6N4O2Zn: C, 37.60; H, 2.37; N, 21.92% Found: C, 37.63; H, 2.76; N, 20.48%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of ZIF-202, Cu2Zn(Im)4A mixture of Zn(OAc)2·2H2O (0.052 g, 0.24 mmol) and [Cu(HIm)4](NO3)2 (0.092 g, 0.20 mmol) was dissolved using a solvent mixture of DMF/water/MeOH (2/1/1, v/v). The pH of the solution mixture was adjusted to ca. 5.4 by addition of acetic acid. The solution mixture was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube. The tube was flash frozen at 77 K using a liquid N2 bath, evacuated for 15 min to remove oxygen, and then flame-sealed to maintain a oxygen-free environment inside the tube during the reaction process. After the sealed reaction tube was heated at 85 °C for 4 d, truncated colorless crystals were obtained. The crystals were subsequently collected and washed with DMF, water, and MeOH (3 × 2 mL, each) before SXRD analysis. For the activation procedure, as-synthesized ZIF-202 was washed five times with DMF per day (5 mL each), exchanged nine times with anhydrous MeOH (5 mL each) over the course of 3 d, and then activated at 80 °C under reduced pressure (1 mTorr) for 24 h. Yield: 65% based on copper imidazole complex. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu2ZnC12H12N8 = Cu2Zn(Im)4: C, 31.28; H, 2.63; N, 24.32%. Found: C, 31.29; H, 2.54; N, 24.10%. ICP-OES of activated sample (2.0 mg of ZIF-202 in 10 mL of HNO3 (1.68 M)): Cu, 4.531 ppm; Zn, 2.338 ppm. FT-IR (KBr, 3500–400 cm–1): 3144 (w), 3112 (w), 1699 (w), 1654 (w), 1614 (m), 1486 (s), 1465 (s), 1316 (m), 1275 (m), 1236 (m), 1172 (s), 1114 (w), 1085 (vs), 985 (w), 955 (s), 846 (w), 828 (s), 766 (s), 663 (s), 645 (w).

The pH of solution mixture was adjusted to 8.5 by addition of TBAOH. The solution mixture was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube. The flame-sealed tube was prepared in the same way as ZIF-202, which was left at room temperature for 6 d. Several single crystals of ZIF-203 were obtained on the walls of the sealed tube and were collected for SXRD analysis. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu3Zn2C30H36N20O3 = Cu3Zn2(Im)10·3H2O: C, 34.44; H, 3.47; N, 26.78%. Found: C, 34.51; H, 3.17; N, 26.49%. The pH of solution mixture was adjusted to 8.5 through the addition of TBAOH. The solution was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube, and the flame-sealed tube was prepared in the same way as ZIF-203. Microcrystalline powder was obtained after allowing the sealed reaction vessel to sit for 14 d at room temperature. This powder was then collected and washed with DMF, water, and acetonitrile (3 x 2 mL, each). Several single crystals of ZIF-204 were obtained on the wall of the sealed tubes, which were used for SXRD analysis. For the activation procedure, as-synthesized ZIF-204 was washed five times with DMF per day (5 mL each), exchanged nine times with anhydrous MeOH over the course of 3 d (5 mL each), and then activated at 80 °C under reduced pressure (1 mTorr) for 24 h. Yield: 60% based on Zn(OAc)2·2H2O. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu3Zn2C30H30N20 = Cu3Zn2(Im)10: C, 36.32; H, 3.05; N, 28.23%. Found: C, 35.86; H, 2.87; N, 27.74%. ICP-OES of activated sample (5.21 mg of ZIF-204 in 10 mL of HNO3 (1.68 M)): Cu, 10.12 ppm; Zn, 7.15 ppm. A mixture of Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.1 mmol, 0.5mL of 0.2 M stock solution in DMF), HnIM (0.085 mmol, 0.425 mL of 0.2 M stock solution in DMF),IM (0.1 mmol, 0.5 mL of 0.2 M stock solution in DMF), and HbbIM (0.4 mmol, 2.0 mL of 0.2 M stocksolution in DMF) was sealed in a 4-mL glass vial and heated at 65 °C for 12 days. Colorless rod-shapedcrystals were collected and washed with anhydrous DMF (3 x 4 ml). (Yield: 19% based on Zn).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of ZnO@[Zn2?L2)2(HCOO)(OH)] (DMF)0.5 = CP-1.In a sealed tube (type A, company: Ace) 0.121 g (0.81 mmol)of 2-trifluoromethylimidazole (L2), and 0.342 g of Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.81 mmol) were dissolved in 5 mL N,N'-dimethyl formamide (DMF). The sealed tube was closed and the mix ture was heated at 125 °C for 24 hours and was then allowedto cool down to room temperature with 5 °C per hour. A col orless crystalline material was formed. The fine crystallineproduct was washed with DMF and EtOH and dried in air.Yield for CP-1: 0.172 g (?55%) based on L2; IR (KBr pellet):vmax = 3444 (m), 3342 (m), 3252 (m), 1650 (vs), 1587 (s), 1510(s), 1285 (s), 1253 (m), 1100 (m), 1023 (m), 727 cm?1 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of [Zn(L1)(L2)] = ZIF-318. In a sealed tube (typeA, company: Ace) 0.018 g (0.22 mmol) of 2-methylimidazole(L1), 0.031 g (0.22 mmol) of 2-trifluoromethylimidazole (L2),and 0.059 g of Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.22 mmol) were dissolved in3 mL of N,N'-diethylformamide (DEF). The sealed tube wasclosed and the mixture was heated at 135 °C for 48 hours andwas then allowed to cool down to room temperature with 5 °Cper hour. Light brown color crystals were washed with DEF andEtOH and dried in air. Under the same conditions with DMFsolvent, light yellow crystals of ZIF-318 were also formed butwith ZnO impurities. Single X-ray crystallographic measure ment was done using the crystals, obtained under the same re action conditions in DMF because of good diffraction quality(see ESI?). Yield for ZIF-318: 0.031 g (48.7% based on Zn?NO3)2·4H2O); IR (KBr pellet): vmax = 3458 (m), 2931 (m), 1678 (s),1581 (vs), 1461 (s), 1371 (s), 1309 (s), 1277 (s), 1226 (vs), 1185(vs), 1144 (vs), 1098 (s), 1003 (vs), 954 (s), 828 (s), 745 cm?1 (vs)

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:For the synthesis of [Zn(im)2·0.5py]-neb, a solution of 1.36 g(20.0 mmol) imidazole in 30 mL (0.51 mmol) of EtOH is poured intoa solution of 1.82 g (8.30 mmol) of Zn(OAc)2·2H2O in 30 mL (0.37mmol) of pyridine. A voluminous amorphous solid forms instantaneouslyupon mixing. The resultant mixture has the molar ratio Zn/Him/py/EtOH = 1: 2.4: 45: 62. The mixture is stirred at room temperaturefor 24 h. Thereafter, the white solid is recovered by filtration,washed with EtOH and dried. The yield is 62% based on Zn. Thematerial is a pure phase according to powder XRD. TG traces measuredin a flow of air reveal a first mass loss of 18% between 120 and220 °C corresponding to the escape of pyridine (calc. 18%) and asecond mass loss of 49% between 400 and 750 °C corresponding tothe oxidative decomposition of [Zn(im)2] into ZnO (calc. 48%). Variable-temperature powder XRD patterns demonstrate frameworkcollapse at temperatures between 120 and 220 °C with formation of[Zn(im)2]-coi at temperatures above 120 °C and, subsequently, formationof [Zn(im)2]-zni and an amorphous phase at temperaturesabove 220 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:For the synthesis of [Zn(im)2·0.5mor]-neb, a solution of 0.47 g(6.86 mmol) of imidazole in 10 mL (0.17 mmol) of EtOH is pouredinto a suspension of 1.02 g (3.43 mmol) Zn(NO3)2·6H2O in 15 mL (0.17mmol) of morpholine. The resultant gelatinous mixture has themolar ratio Zn/Him/mor/EtOH = 1: 2: 50: 50. The mixture is stirred atroom temperature for 24 h and then heated in an oil bath to 140 °C for 4 h under continuous stirring. After cooling to room temperature,the colorless crystals are recovered by filtration, washed with EtOHand dried. The yield is 83% based on Zn. The material is a pure phaseaccording to powder XRD. TG traces measured in a flow of air reveala first mass loss of 17% between 150 and 320 °C corresponding tothe escape of morpholine (calc. 17%) and a second mass loss of 49%between 320 and 700 °C corresponding to the oxidative decompositionof [Zn(im)2] into ZnO (calc. 50%). Variable-temperature powderXRD patterns demonstrate framework collapse at a temperature ofapproximately 240 °C with formation of [Zn(im)2]-zni.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-1(sod): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.267 g, 1.0 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.410 g, 5.0 mmol) dissolved in 15 mL n-butanol was placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 120 °C for 24 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless (or pale yellow) crystals were washed with ethanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 55%);

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-2(mer): a) synthesis of the single crystal for X-ray diffraction. a mixture of cadmium nitrate tetrahydrate (0.154 g, 0.5 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.0821 g, 1.0 mmol) in N-methyl-pyrrolidione (NMP) (5 mL) was placed in a 10 mL trial that was stirred until all starting materials dissolved. This vial was inserted in a larger vial containing another 10 mL vial filled with triethylamine (0.2 mL) and the NMP (5 mL). The larger vial was sealed and left undisturbed for about two weeks to crystallize. The colorless crystal was selected for single crystal analysis;

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:b) synthesis of bulk sample of CdIF-2: to A mixture of cadmium nitrate tetrahydrate (1.109 g, 3.6 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.591 g, 7.2 mmol) in N-methyl-pyrrolidione (NMP) (30 mL), 10 mL NMP containing 1.0 mL triethylamine was added under stirring at room temperature in ca. 2 hours. Then, the reactant mixture was left stirring at room temperature for anther 46 hours. The white participate was filtered and left to air-dry, yielding ca. 0.45 g white powder that was confirmed to be CdIF-2 for its XRD similar to that simulated from the corresponding single crystal date.However, as a large amount of NMP was evacuated from the framework of CdIF-2, its structural integrity had been lost and finally became to amorphous solid.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-3 (yqt1): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.267 g, 1.0 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.410 g, 5.0 mmol) dissolved in 15 mL methanol were placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 90 °C for 24 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless crystals were washed with ethanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 50%);

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-4 (rho): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.534 g, 2.0 mmol) and 2-ethylimidazole (0.961 g, 10.0 mmol) dissolved in 20 mL methanol was placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 120 °C for 12 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless (or pale yellow) crystals were washed with methanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 60 %);

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-6 (ana): A mixture of Cd(CH3COO)2·2H2O (0.267g, 1 mmol), Heim (0.192 g, 2 mmol), anhydrous piperazine (0.084 g, 1 mmol) were added to ethanol (20 mL), and after being stirred for 12 hours, this heterogeneous mixture was placed into a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 60 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-4 (rho) mixed with CdIF-6 (ana) were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-7α (dia): A mixture of Cd(NO3)·4H2O (0.0154g, 0.05 mmol), Hnim (0.0226 g, 0.2 mmol) and DMF/benzenemethanol (3 mL / 3 mL) was placed into a 15 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 100 °C for 20 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-7β (dia): A mixture of Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O (0.0209g, 0.05 mmol), Hnim (0.0113 g, 0.1 mmol) and DMF (8 mL) was placed into a 15 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 72 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-7β (dia) (C12H8N12O8Cd2?0.25DMF) mixed with CdIF-9 (rho) were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-8 (sod): A mixture of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.192g, 0.625 mmol), Hnim (0.1425 g, 1.25 mmol) and DMF (15 mL) was placed into a 15 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 12 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-8 were separated by filtration. X-ray single crystal analysis reveals a zeolitic sodalite-like structure and XRD spectrum for the bulk sample is agreeable to that simulated from the X-ray single crystal data. However, as CdIF-8 was washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and evacuated in vacuum, its zeolitic sodalite structure was destroyed.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CdIF-9 (rho): A mixture of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.192g, 0.625 mmol), Hnim (0.1425 g, 1.25 mmol) and DMA (15 mL) was placed into a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 100 °C for 12 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-9 were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Co-ZIF-68 [C10H7CoN5O2. DMF]: 1 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of Co(NO3)2.6H2O was added to 1.5 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of 2 nitro imidazole and 1 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of benzimidazole in a 5 ml culture tube and heated 120 °C temperature for 24h. Plate like pink crystals were collected by filtration (75% yield by Co) and washed with DMF and dry acetone then dried in air

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Co-ZIF-69 [C10H5Cl2CoN5O2. DMF]: 1 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of Co(NO3)2.6H2O was added to 1.0 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of 2 nitro imidazole and 3 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of 5-chlorobenzimidazole in a 5 ml culture tube and heated 120 °C temperature for 12h. pink crystals were collected by filtration (77% yield by Co) and washed with DMF and dry acetone then dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Co-ZIF-81 [C10H5Br2CoN5O2. DMF]: 1 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of Co(NO3)2.6H2O was added to 1.0 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of 2 nitro imidazole and 2 ml 0.2(M) DMF solution of 5-bromobenzimidazole in a 5 ml culture tube and heated 120 °C temperature for 12h. pink crystals were collected by filtration (60% yield by Co) and washed with DMF and dry acetone then dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:The typical synthesis of TIF-1Zn: Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (118.8mg), 5,6-dimethyl-benzimidazole (157.6mg), (±)-2-amino-1-butanol (4.0mL) and benzene(3.2mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for half an hour. The autoclave was then sealed and heated at 150 °C for 5 days, followed by cooling to room temperature. A large amount of colorless crystals were obtained with a yield of 43.2% (based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed using ethanol three times and dried in air for other measurements. IR data for as-synthesized TIF-1Zn (KBr, cm-1): 1475s, 1337m, 1203m, 1167w,1093w, 1021w, 848m, 813w, 648w. The synthesis of TIF-1Co is similar with that of TIF-1Zn, except for the replacement of the Zn(Ac)2·2H2O by Co(Ac)2·4H2O. A large amount of violet powder was obtained with a yield of 39.2%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of TIF-2. Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (117.8 mg, 0.5367mmol),5-methylbenzimidazole (70.3 mg, 0.5320mmol), imidazole (44.2mg, 0.6492mmol), ()-2-amino-1-butanol (4.0 mL), and benzene(3.6 mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h.The autoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 5 days,followed by cooling down to room temperature. A large amountof small colorless crystalline materials were obtained with a yieldof 35.4% (based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed usingethanol three times and dried in air for other measurements.Elemental analysis of as-synthesized sample: C, 49.22; H, 4.02;N, 20.98. Elemental analysis of sample dried at 300 °C: C, 47.93;H, 3.78; N, 20.78.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of TIF-3. Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (116.2 mg, 0.5294 mmol),5-methylbenzimidazole (71.2 mg, 0.5387 mmol), imidazole (41.7mg, 0.6125 mmol), ()-2-amino-1-butanol (4.0 mL) and benzene(0.4 mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h.The autoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 6 days,followed by cooling to room temperature. Small colorless crystalswere obtained as a minor phase, accompanied with a large amountof unidentified polycrystalline powder.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of TIF-4. Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (114.5 mg, 0.5216 mmol),5-methylbenzimidazole (26.9 mg, 0.2035 mmol), imidazole (57.6mg, 0.8461 mmol), 3-amino-1-propanol (4.0 mL) and benzene(2.0mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h.The autoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 5 days,followed by cooling to room temperature. A large amount ofcolorless octahedral crystalline materials was obtained with a yieldof 42.3% (based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed usingethanol three times and dried in air for other measurements.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of TIF-5Zn. Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (122.7 mg, 0.5590 mmol),5,6-dimethylbenzimidazole (77.2 mg, 0.5281 mmol), imidazole(60.7 mg, 0.8916), ()-2-amino-1-butanol (3.0 mL), and p-xylene(1.0 mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h.The autoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 5 days,followed by cooling to room temperature. A large amount ofcolorless crystalline materials was obtained with a yield of 35.5%(based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed using ethanol threetimes and dried in air for other measurements.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of TIF-5Co. Co(Ac)2·4H2O (128.2 mg, 0.5147 mmol),5,6-dimethylbenzimidazole (80.2 mg, 0.5486 mmol), imidazole(50.9 mg, 0.7476 mmol), and 3-amino-1-propanol (6.0 mL) aremixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h. Theautoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 5 days,followed by cooling to room temperature. A large amount of violetcrystalline materials was obtained with a yield of 44.3% (based oncobalt salt). The crystals were washed using ethanol three timesand dried in air for other measurements.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn(5-mtz)(2-eim).x(guest) (ZTIF-1): The mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.5 mmol, 0.110 g), 5-methyltetrazole (5-mtz, 0.5 mmol, 0.043 g), 2-ethylimidazole (2-eim, 0.5 mmol, 0.48 g) in DMF (2 ml) and ethanol (2ml) was sealed in a 20 ml vial and heated to 120 °C for 3 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The yellow polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 50%). The micro-synthesis condition of ZTIF-1 can be scalable to 1 gram scale by using the same reaction conditions in a larger volume (50 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor).Synthesis of Zn(5-mtz)(2-pim).x(guest) (ZTIF-2): ZTIF-2 was obtained by the similar method as described for ZTIF-1 except for using 2-propylimidazole (2-pim) instead of 2-eim (Yield: 48%). The micro-synthesis condition of ZTIF-2 can also be scalable to 1 gram scale by using the same reaction conditions in a larger volume (50 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor). The co-existence of 5-mtz and 2-pim in ZTIF-1 are proved by 1H NMR.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn15(5-etz)16(2-eim)11(OH-)3(H2O)3.x(guest) (FIR-30). The mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.5 mmol, 0.110 g), 5-ethyltetrazole (5-etz, 0.5 mmol, 0.043 g), 2-ethylimidazole (2-eim, 0.5 mmol, 0.48 g) in DMF (2 ml) and ethanol (2ml) was sealed in a 20 ml vial and heated to 120 °C for 3 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The colorless polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with DMF and ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 54%). In comparison, under same reaction condition, the product of the mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.5 mmol, 0.110 g) and 2-ethylimidazole (2-eim, 0.5 mmol, 0.48 g) in DMF (2 ml) and ethanol (2ml) produced ZIF-14 with ANA topology. No crystalline product was obtained from the mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.5 mmol, 0.110 g) and 5-ethyltetrazole (5-etz, 0.5 mmol, 0.043 g) in DMF (2 ml) and ethanol (2ml). Furthermore, the yields of FIR-30decreased with the reduction of any azolate ligands. We randomly selected 10 single crystals from one vial and found that they had same unit cell. The powder-XRD (PXRD) results measure by crystalline samples are also presented. The micro-synthesis condition of FIR-30 can be scalable to 1 gram scale by using the same reaction conditions in a larger volume (50 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor). The co-existence of 5-etz and 2-eim in FIR-30 is proved by 1H NMR. Elemental analysis (EA) of the activated samples is presented. The ratio of these two ligands has been obtained from the EA results. Elemental analysis (activated) Zn15C125N86O6H166·(H2O)20: Calcd. C, 34.82; H, 4.82; N, 27.94; Zn, 22.76. Found C, 34.28; H, 5.04; N, 27.85; Zn, 22.48 (ICP).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn2(5-mtz)3(2-mbim)·guest (ZTIF-6): the mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.500 mmol, 0.110 g), 5-methyltetrazole (5-mtz, 0.500 mmol, 0.042 g), 2-methylbenzimdazole (2-mbim, 0.500 mmol, 0.066 g) in DMF (2 mL) and ethanol (2 mL) was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 2 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The pale yellow polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 60%). Anal. Calcd for C14H16N14Zn2 (activated): Calcd. C, 32.88; H, 3.13; N, 38.36; Found C, 33.02; H, 3.07; N, 38.48. IR (KBr cm-1): 2936 (m), 1671 (s), 1499 (s), 1390 (vs), 1281 (m), 1095 (s), 760 (m), 695 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn2(tz)2(2-mbim)2·DMF (ZTIF-7): the mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.500 mmol, 0.110 g), tetrazole (tz, 0.500 mmol, 0.035 g), 2-methylbenzimdazole (2-mbim, 0.500 mmol, 0.066 g) in DMF (2 mL) and ethanol (2 mL) was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 2 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The colorless polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 65%). Anal. Calcd for C18H16N12Zn2(activated): Calcd. C, 40.66; H, 3.01; N, 31.63; Found C, 40.52; H, 3.17; N, 31.71. IR (KBr cm-1): 2922 (w), 1669 (s), 1457 (s), 1390 (vs), 1281 (m), 1075 (s), 758 (m), 687 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn(5-mtz)(2-mim)?H2O?DMF (ZTIF-8): The mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2(H2O) (0.500 mmol, 0.110 g), 2-methylimidazole (2-Hmim, 0.500 mmol, 0.041g), 5-methyltetrazole (5-Hmtz, 0.500 mmol, 0.043 g), in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF, 2 mL) and ethanol (2 mL) was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 48h, and then cooled to room-temperature. The colorless polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 60%). ZTIF-8 can be scalable to 1 gram scale by using the same reaction conditions in a larger volume (50 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor). The co-existence of 5-mtz and 2-mim in ZTIF-8 are proved by 1H NMR (Fig. S1). The ratio of 5-mtz and 2-mim is around 1:1. Anal. Calcd for C6H6N6Zn: Calcd. C, 31.67; H, 2.66; N, 36.94; Found C, 31.53; H, 2.69; N, 36.86. IR (KBr cm-1): 2938 (m), 1649 (s), 1463 (s), 1378 (vs), 1225 (m), 1090 (s), 776 (m), 687 (m).Fig. S1. The 1H NMR spectra of ZTIF-8 dissolved by HCl in MeOD solvent. The peak at 3.33 ppm is for MeOD, and peak at 5.01 ppm is for H2O.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of ZIF-8: The mixture of ZnNO3·6(H2O) (0.250 mmol, 0.075 g), 2-methylimidazole (2-Hmim, 0.500 mmol, 0.041g) in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF, 3 mL), and small amount of HNO3 was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 48h, and then cooled to room-temperature. The pale yellow polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 63%).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn(5-etz)0.84(2-mim)1.14 (ZTIF-9): The mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2H2O (0.5 mmol, 0.110g), 5-ethyltetrazole (Hetz, 0.5 mmol, 0.049 g), 2-methylimidazole (Hmim, 0.5 mmol, 0.041 g) in N,N dimethylformamide (DMF, 2 mL) and ethanol (2 mL) was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 3 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The colorless polyhedral crystals were obtained,washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 55%). Anal. Calcd for ZTIF-9 (activated):Calcd. C, 35.55; H, 4.18; N, 33.16; Found C, 35.33; H, 4.18; N, 33.09

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn(5-vtz)0.63(2-mim)1.37 (ZTIF-10): The mixture of Zn(CH3CO2)2·2H2O (0.5 mmol,0.110 g), 5-vinyltetrazole (Hvtz, 0.5 mmol, 0.050 g), Hmim (0.5 mmol, 0.041 g) in DMF (2 mL) andethanol (2 mL) was sealed in a 20 mL vial and heated to 120 °C for 3 days, and then cooled to room temperature. The pale yellow polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried atroom temperature (Yield: 52%). Anal. Calcd for ZTIF-10 (activated): Calcd. C, 37.48; H, 3.73; N,31.11; Found C, 37.59; H, 3.81; N, 30.71.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn5(tz)2(nim)8 (ZTIF-11): the mixture of Zn(NO3)2·6(H2O) (0.25 mmol, 0.075 g),tetrazole (tz, 0.10 mmol, 0.007 g), 2-nitroimidazole (nim, 0.40 mmol, 0.045 g) in Ethylene Glycol(2 ml) was sealed in a 20 ml vial and heated to 120 °C for 1 days, and then cooled to room temperature. The pale yellow polyhedral crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried atroom temperature (Yield: 51%). The micro-synthesis condition of ZTIF-11 can be scalable to 0.43gram scale by using the same reaction conditions in a larger volume (23 mL Teflon-lined stainlesssteel reactor). The co-existence of tz and nim in ZTIF-11 are proved by 1HNMR. To prove thephase purity of the bulk sample, the powder-XRD (PXRD) and elemental analysis (EA) of theElectronic Supplementary Material (ESI) for Inorganic Chemistry Frontiers.This journal is ? the Partner Organisations 2018activated samples are presented here. A comparison calculated/found EA of the activated samplesproved the phase purity of the sample. The ratio of these two ligands has been obtained from thesingle crystal data as well as EA results. Anal. Calcd for C26H18N32O16Zn5: Calcd. C, 22.93; H,1.33; N, 32.92; Found C, 22.99; H, 1.38; N, 32.85. IR (KBr cm-1): 2936 (m), 1652 (s), 1500(s),1365 (vs), 1281 (m), 951 (s), 794 (m), 695 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Zn2(ptz)(nim)3 (ZTIF-12): Zn(NO3)2·6(H2O) (0.25 mmol, 0.075 g), 5-phenyl-1H tetrazole (ptz, 0.125 mmol, 0.018 g), 2-nitroimidazole (nim, 0.375 mmol, 0.042 g) in EthyleneGlycol (2 ml) was sealed in a 20 ml vial and heated to 120 °C for 2 days, and then cooled to room temperature. The yellow crystals were obtained, washed with ethanol, and dried at roomtemperature (Yield: 55%). Anal. Calcd for C16H11N13O6Zn2: Calcd. C, 31.39; H, 1.81; N, 29.75;Found C, 31.30; H, 1.85; N, 29.86. IR (KBr cm-1): 2922 (w), 1669 (s), 1457 (s), 1386 (vs), 1284(m), 1075 (s), 758 (m), 687 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of HZIrF-1R.The mixture of Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O(0.5 mmol, 0.110 g), R-OH-bim (0.5 mol, 0.086 g), 5-mtz (0.5mmol, 0.045 g) ethanol (3 ml) and N,N-dimethylformamide (3 ml) was sealed in a 20 ml vial and heated to 120 °C for 3 days, and then cooled to room-temperature. The light yellow crystals were obtained in pure phase, washed with ethanol, and dried at room temperature (Yield: 50% yield based on Zn). Anal. Calcd. (%) for C18H25N15O2Zn2(614.27): H: 4.04, C: 48.10, N: 12.47. Found: H 4.10, C 48.07, N 12.48. IR (KBr pellet, cm-1): 3288b, 2983s, 2939m, 2881w, 1650s, 1541w, 1506w, 1438m, 1396m, 1274m, 1118m, 1072m, 1024m, 919m, 829m, 759m, 692m, 648m, 418m. With exception of DMF, other amide solvents such as formamide, N-methylformamide, N,N-dimethylacetamide, 1-methyl-2-pyrrolidinone, 1,3-dimethyl-2-imidazolidinone (DMI), tetrahydro-1,3-dimethyl-2(1H) pyrimidine (DMPU) and 1-formylpiperidine 3have also been investigated in the system of HZIrF-1. And ethanol can also be replaced by other methanol solvents, such as methanol, 1-propanol, 2-propanol, 1-butanol, 2-butanol, benzyl alcohol, and so on. In all the solvents system above, the same SOD-type framework can be obtained. Thus, solvents can't be effective structure directed agents (SDAs) in the synthesis of HZIrF-1. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:IRMOF-2, Zn4O(C8H3BrO4)3. 2-Bromobenzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (0.38 g, 1.6 mmol, Aldrich) and zinc nitrate tetrahydrate (1.5 g,5.7 mmol, EM Science) were dissolved in 100 mL of N,N-diethylfor mamide (BASF) with stirring in a 1-L wide mouth glass jar. After decanting the hot mother liquor and rinsing with DMF,the product was immersed in chloroform (Fisher) for 3 d, during whichthe activation solvent was decanted and freshly replenished three times.The solvent was removed under vacuum at room temperature, yieldingthe porous material.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of MOF-5. Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (1.19 g, 4 mmol) and 1,4-benzenedicarboxylicacid (0.34 g, 2 mmol) were dissolved in 40 ml of DMF during vigorous stirring atroom temperature. Three drops of H2O2 aqueous solution (30 wt%) was added to thesolution. Triethylamin (2.3 ml) was slowly added dropwise to the above solutionunder vigorous agitation for 1 h. The white product was collected by repeatedfiltering, thorough washing with DMF for three times. The sample was degassedfirstly at room temperature for 6 h, then heated to 180 °C at a heating rate of 1 °C/minand held at this temperature for 12 h under degassing in vacuum. The yield is ~80%based on zinc. Anal. Calcd. for Zn4O(C8H4O4)3·H2O (MOF-5? Synthesis of IRMOF-8. The synthesis of IRMOF-8 followed the same procedures aspreparing MOF-5 described above. The only difference was that 2,6-naphtalenedicarboxylic acid (0.43 g, 2 mmol) was used instead of 1,4-benzenedicarboxylic acid for the synthesis of IRMOF-8. The yield is ~70% based onzinc. Anal. Calcd. for Zn4O(C12H6O4)3?2H2O (IRMOF-8?2H2O): Zn, 27.25%; C,45.28%; O, 25.16%. Found: Zn, 27.02%; C, 45.13%; O, 25.48%

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of IRMOF-18, Zn4O(TMBDC)3 2,3,5,6-tetramethylbenzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (1.2 g, 5.4 mmol, Chem Service) and zinc nitrate hexahydrate (12 g, 40 mmol, Aldrich) were dissolved in 600 mL of N,N diethylformamide (BASF) with stirring and distributed into six large glass crystallization dishes. The covered dishes were heated for 48 hr at 70 °C, during which time a white polycrystalline solid formed on the surface of the vessel. After removal from the oven, the mother liquor was decanted and the solid was washed with N,N-dimethylformamide to remove unreacted material. The vessels were then filled with 100 mL of chloroform (Fisher), immersing the product. This solvent volume was replaced after 4 hr and allowed to sit for 16 hr before replacing the solvent a second time. After immersion for another 24 hr, the solids were scraped off the surface of the vessel and filtered. The guest chloroform was removed under vacuum (<10-3 Torr) to yield the porous material (1.3 g, 77 % yield). The composition was confirmed as Zn4O13C36H36 by elemental analysis: (% calculated, found) C: 46.1, 46.1, H: 3.87, 3.86, Zn: 27.9, 25.4. The powder X-ray diffraction pattern (Bruker AXS D8 Advance diffractometer, Bragg-Brentano geometry, Cu Kα radiation) of the porous form matches that calculated from the single crystal structure determination. The bands in the FT IR spectrum (Perkin Elmer Spectrum BX, KBr pellet, 4000-400 cm-1) are consistent with the organic module: 3428 (br), 2987 (m), 2953 (m), 2927 (m), 2867 (m), 1545 (s), 1443 (s), 1386 (m) 1369 (m), 1234 (m), 1051 (w), 1023 (w), 871 (w), 846 (w), 699 (m), 516 (m), 498 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:5. Synthesis and characterization of NU-1100. 13 mg (40.3 μmol ) of ZrOCl2x8H2O and 900 mg (7.4 mmol) of benzoic acid were dissolved in 5 ml of DMF in a 6 dram vial and heated at 80 ?C for 30 min. Then the solution was cooled to room temperature (RT) and 15 mg (19.3 μmol) of LH4 were added and sonicated for 15 min. After 2 h soaking at RT the mixture was placed into an oven at 120 °C for 4 days. Then the solution was decanted and crystals werewashed with fresh DMF repeating the procedure 4 times followed by washing with acetone (4 times). Finally, crystals were soaked in acetone overnight, filtered and dried under dynamic vacuum at 120 °C to yield 7 mg of activated NU-1100. The procedure was repeated using 50 identical vials to get sufficient amount for further characterization.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis Concerning MIL-100, due to the presence of significant amount of metallic chromium during the synthesis conditions reported previously,[1] another synthetic route involving chromium(VI) oxide was developed. To 0.5 g of chromium (VI) oxide CrO3, 1,05 g of trimesic acid, 1.0 ml of a 5 M hydrofluorohydric solution and 24 ml of de-ionized water were added and stirred a few minutes at room temperature. The slurry was then introduced in a Teflon-line Paar hydrothermal bomb and set four days at 220 °C. The resulting green solid was washed with de-ionized water and acetone and dried at room temperature under air atmosphere.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-303, Al(OH)(PZDC). The synthesis of MOF-303 was adopted from our previous reports22,34. In a 200 L glass re-action vessel equipped with a heating jacket, a mixture of H2PZDC·H2O (3.48 kg, 20 mol) and NaOH (2.4 kg, 60 mol) was dissolved in 38 L deionized water. The resulting solution was stirred for 60 minutes until all the solids were completely dissolved and the solution cooled down to room temperature. Next, in a 20 L beaker, AlCl3·6H2O (4.82 kg, 20 mol) was dis-solved in 12 L deionized water and transferred to a 15 L glass material-feeding funnel. The 12 L aluminum chloride solution was slowly added to the 38 L linker solution in the vessel at a rate of 6 L per hour with vigorous stirring. The total addition time lasted 2 hours, and the white precipitate formed during the addition. Afterward, the temperature of the heating jacket was set to 120 °C, thus heating the reaction mixture to 100 °C. After refluxing for 6 hours and letting the reaction mixture cool down to 60 °C, the white solid product was collected in a 20 L filtration funnel. For purification, the white powder was subsequently redispersed by stirring in 15 L aqueous 70% EtOH (v/v) solution, filtered off, and washed again with 30 L anhydrous EtOH at room temperature, followed by filtration and drying under air overnight. The obtained white powder was placed in a 120 °C oven for 48 hours to yield the pure and desolvated product (3.61 kg, 91% based on the linker).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MIL-160, Al(OH)(FDC). In a 200 L glass reaction ves-sel equipped with a heating jacket, a mixture of H2FDC (3.12 kg, 20 mol) and NaOH (2.4 kg, 60 mol) was dissolved in 40 L deionized water. The resulting solution was stirred for 60 minutes until all the solids were completely dissolved and the solution cooled down to room temperature. Next, in a 20 L beaker, AlCl3·6H2O (4.82 kg, 20 mol) was dissolved in 10 L deionized water and transferred to a 15 L glass ma-terial-feeding funnel. The 10 L aluminum chloride solution was slowly added to 40 L linker solution in the vessel at a rate of 5 L per hour with vigorous stirring. The total addition time lasted 2 hours, and the white precipitate formed during the addition. Afterward, the temperature of the heating jacket was set to 120 °C, thus heating the reaction mixture to 100 °C. After refluxing for 6 hours and letting the reaction mixture cool down to 60 °C, the white solid product was collected in a 20 L filtration funnel. For purification, the white powder was subsequently redispersed by stirring in 15 L aqueous 70% EtOH (v/v) solution, filtered off, and washed again with 30 L anhydrous EtOH at room temperature, followed by filtration and drying under air overnight. The obtained white powder was placed in a 120 °C oven for 48 hours to yield the pure and desolvated product (3.64 kg, 92% based on the linker).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-313, Al(OH)(2,5-PylDC). In a 1 L glass round bot-tom flask, a mixture of H2PylDC (31 g, 0.2 mol) and NaOH (24 g, 0.6 mol) was dissolved in 0.4 L deionized water. The resulting solution was stirred for 10 minutes until all the sol-ids were completely dissolved. Next, AlCl3·6H2O (48.2 g, 0.2 mol) was dissolved in 0.1 L deionized water and added to the round bottom flask dropwise with vigorous stirring. The total addition time lasted 2 hours, and the white precipitate formed during the addition. Afterward, the reaction mixture was heated to 120 °C. After refluxing for 6 hours and letting the reaction mixture cool down to room temperature, the white solid product was collected by centrifugation. For purification, the white powder was washed twice with deionized water and subsequently washed three times with EtOH. The white solid was air-dried overnight. Full activation of the MOF was conducted in vacuo at 120 °C for 24 hours, yielding pure and desolvated product (38 g, 96% based on the linker).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Al-fumarate, Al(OH)(Fum). In a 200 L glass reaction ves-sel equipped with a heating jacket, a mixture of fumaric acid (2.32 kg, 20 mol) and NaOH (2.4 kg, 60 mol) was dissolved in 26 L deionized water. The resulting solution was stirred for 60 minutes until all the solids were completely dissolved and the solution cooled down to room temperature. Next, AlCl3·6H2O (4.82 kg, 20 mol) was dissolved in 24 L deionized water and divided into two equal portions. The first portion (12 L) was transferred to a 15 L glass material-feeding funnel and subsequently added to the 26 L linker solution in the vessel slowly at a rate of 12 L per hour with vigorous stirring. The procedure was then repeated for the second portion of the aluminum chloride solution. The total addition time lasted for 2 hours, and the white precipitate formed during the addition. Afterward, the temperature of the heating jacket was set to 110°C, thus heating the reaction mixture to 100 °C. After re-fluxing for 6 hours and letting the reaction mixture cool down to room temperature, the white solid product was collected in a 20 L filtration funnel. For purification, the white powder was subsequently redispersed by stirring in 15 L aqueous 70% EtOH (v/v) solution, filtered off, and washed again with 30 L anhydrous EtOH at room temperature, followed by filtration and drying in air overnight. The obtained white powder was placed in a 120°C oven for 48 hours to yield the pure and des-olvated product (2.97 kg, 94% based on the linker).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:CAU-10, Al(OH)(IPA). In a 200 L glass reaction vessel equipped with a heating jacket, a mixture of isophthalic acid (3.32 kg, 20 mol) and NaOH (2.4 kg, 60 mol) was dissolved in 26 L deionized water. The resulting solution was stirred for 60 minutes until all the solids were completely dissolved and the solution cooled down to room temperature. Next, Al2(SO4)3·18H2O (6.67 kg, 10 mol) was dissolved in 24 L deionized water and divided into two equal portions. The first portion (12 L) was transferred to a 15 L glass material-feeding funnel and subsequently added to the 26 L linker solution in the vessel slowly at a rate of 12 L per hour with vigorous stir-ring. The procedure was then repeated for the second portion of the aluminum sulfate solution. The total addition time lasted 2 hours, and the white precipitate formed during the addition. Afterward, the temperature of the heating jacket was set to 130°C, thus heating the reaction mixture to 100 °C. After re-fluxing for 6 hours and letting the reaction mixture cool down to room temperature, the white solid product was collected in a 20 L filtration funnel. For purification, the white powder was subsequently redispersed by stirring in 15 L deionized water, filtered off, and washed again with 3 x 15 L anhydrous EtOH at room temperature, followed by filtration and drying in air overnight. The obtained white powder was placed in a 120°C oven for 48 hours to yield the pure and desolvated product (3.81 kg, 92% based on the linker).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-177-B, Zn4O(BTB-NH2)2A mixture of the acid form of B (12 mg, 0.025 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (63 mg, 0.22 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DEF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 85 °C for 48 h. Yellow block-shaped crystals were isolated and washed with DEF (3 x 5 mL). To yield guest-free material, the as-synthesized washed sample was fully exchanged with anhydrous DMF (3 x 10 mL for 3 days), followed with anhydrous acetone (3 x 10 mL for 3 days), and finally activated by the SCD method. EA for the activated sample of MOF-177-B: Calcd for Zn4C54H42N6O13 = Zn4O(BTB-NH2)2: C, 52.37; H, 2.93; N, 6.79%. Found: C, 50.12; H, 3.36; N, 5.57%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-177-D, Zn4O(BTB-OCH3)2A mixture of the acid form of D (53 mg, 0.10 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (250 mg, 0.840 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DEF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 100 °C for 20 h. Colorless block-shaped crystals were isolated and washed with DEF (3 x 5 mL). To yield guest-free material, the as-synthesized sample was fully exchanged with chloroform (3 x 10 mL for 3 days) and further activated by the conventional method. EA for the activated sample of MOF-177-D: Calcd for Zn4C60H42O19 = Zn4O(BTB-OCH3)2: C, 54.24; H, 3.19%; Found: C, 52.67; H, 2.59; N, < 0.2%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-177-E, Zn4O(BTB-OC7H7)2A mixture of the acid form of E (76 mg, 0.10 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (250 mg, 0.840 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DEF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 100 °C for 20 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-177-K, Zn4O(BTB-C4H4/NH2)2A mixture of the acid form of K (25 mg, 0.050 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (125 mg, 0.420 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DEF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 100 °C for 48 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-155-F, Zn4O(BTB-F2)2A mixture of the acid form of F (54 mg, 0.10 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (250 mg, 0.840 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DEF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 85 °C for 48 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-155-J, Zn4O(BTB-mNH2)2A mixture of the acid form of J (54 mg, 0.10 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (250 mg, 0.840 mmol) was dissolved in 10 mL of DMF in a 20 mL vial, which was heated at 85 °C for 48 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-180. A solid mixture of H3BTE (7.5 mg, 0.015 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (75 mg, 0.25 mmol) was dissolved in a mixture of DMF/NMP (2.0/2.0 mL) in an 8-mL glass vial. The clear reaction solution was heated in an isotherm oven at 85 °C for 96 h resulting in colorless polyhedral crystals, which were isolated by washing with a mixture of DMF and NMP (3 x 4 mL) and dried in air. Yield: 5.2 mg, 27% based on 1 mol of H3BTE. Elemental microanalysis for Zn4O(BTE)2(H2O)3·H2O ≡ C66H32O14Zn4, calculated (%): C, 60.49; H, 2.46; N, 0.00. Found (%): C, 60.98; H, 2.54; N, 0.06. A solid mixture of H3BBC (22.0 mg, 0.033 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (98.2 mg, 0.33 mmol) was dissolved in a mixture of DEF/NMP (4.0/4.0 mL) in a 20-mL glass vial. The clear reaction solution was heated in an isotherm oven at 85 °C for 24 h resulting in colorless trigonal prismatic crystals, which were isolated by washing with a mixture of DEF and NMP (3 x 4 mL) and dried in air. Yield: 30 mg, 29% based on 1 mol of H3BBC. Elemental microanalysis for Zn4O(BBC)2(H2O)3·H2O ≡ C90H62O17Zn4, calculated (%): C, 64.46; H, 3.73; N, 0.00. Found (%): C, 64.42; H, 3.57; N, 0.00. Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-200 (large scale synthesis). A solid mixture of H3BBC (200 mg, 0.30 mmol) and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (950 mg, 3.19 mmol) was dissolved in a mixture of DEF/NMP (80/80 mL) in a 500-mL Nalgene? high-density polyethylene (HDPE) container. Reaction solution was sonicated for 1 h prior to heating, and then placed in an isothermal oven at 82 °C for 48 h to give the crystals of MOF-200 (150 - 170 mg, 44 - 50% yield based on 1 mol of H3BBC).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:MOF-205. A solid mixture of H3BTB (12.8 mg, 0.029 mmol), and H2NDC (10.5 mg, 0.049 mmol), and Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (42.5 mg, 0.14 mmol) was dissolved in a mixture of DMF/EtOH (3.0/0.3 mL) in a 4-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated in an isothermal oven at 95 °C for 24 h to give colorless truncated-octahedral crystals. The reaction mixture was allowed to cool naturally to room temperature and the crystals were washed with DMF and dried in air. Yield: 21 mg, 68% based on 1 mol of H3BTB. Elemental microanalysis for MOF-205, Zn4O(BTB)4/3(NDC) ≡ C48H26O13Zn4, calculated (%): C, 53.78; H, 2.48; N, 0.00. Found (%): C, 53.58; H, 2.29; N, < 0.1. The vial was capped and heated in an isothermal oven at 95 °C for 72 h to give colorless polyhedral crystals. The reaction mixture was allowed to cool naturally to room temperature and the crystals were washed with DMF and dried in air. Yield: 13 mg, 68% based on 1 mol of H3BTE. Elemental microanalysis for MOF-210, Zn4O(BTE)4/3(BPDC) ≡ C58H28O13Zn4, calculated based on framework only (%): C, 53.78; H, 2.48; N, 0.00. Found (%): C, 53.58; H, 2.29; N, < 0.1. FT-IR (KBr, 4000-400 cm-1): 3338 (s, br), 2206 (w), 1934 (w), 1654 (w), 1604 (vs), 1579 (vs), 1533 (vs), 1407 (vs), 1175 (m), 1098 (w), 1015 (w), 960 (w), 859 (m), 770 (s), 744 (w), 699 (w), 679 (w), 607 (w), 526 (w), 471 (w), 456 (m), 439 (m), 419 (m).

Paragraph_2_reaction_temperature:Synthesis of Cu3(BTB)2(H2O)3: (MOF-143).
