paragraph: Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-1 crb) : Zn(IM)2·(Me2NH). A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.09 g, 3.44 × 10-4 mol) and imidazole (H-IM) (0.15 g, 2.20 × 10-3 mol) was dissolved in 18 mL DMF in a 20-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated for 24 h in a 85 °C isothermal oven. The vial was then removed from the oven and allowed to cool to room temperature naturally. Colorless cubic crystals of ZIF-1 thus produced were washed with DMF (3 mL × 3) and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.014 g, 17% based on zinc nitrate tetrahydrate).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-3 dft) : Zn(IM)2. A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.010 g, 3.82 × 10-5 mol) and imidazole (H-IM) (0.030 g, 4.41 × 10-4 mol) was added in a 4-mL vial and dissolved in a mixed solvent of DMF (2 mL) and NMP (1 mL). The vial was capped and heated for 4 d in a 85 °C isothermal oven. The vial was then removed from the oven and allowed to cool to room temperature naturally. Several prism-shaped crystals formed at the bottom of the vial along with some white powder-like precipitate. The crystals of ZIF-3 were collected manually for single crystal X-ray structure determination.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-4 cag) : Zn(IM)2·(DMF)(H2O) A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.040 g, 1.53 × 10-4 mol) and imidazole (H-IM) (0.030 g, 4.41 × 10-4 mol) was dissolved in 3 mL DMF in a 4-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated at a rate 5 °C /min to 130 °C in a programmable oven, held at this temperature for 48 h, then cooled at a rate of 0.4 ?C/min to room temperature. Colorless rhombohedral crystals of ZIF-4 thus produced were washed with DMF (3 mL × 3) and dried in the air (10 min) (yield: 0.021 g, 47% based on zinc nitrate tetrahydrate).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-7 sod) : Zn(PhIM)2·(H2O)3. A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.030 g, 1.15 × 10-4 mol) and benzimidazole (H-PhIM) (0.010 g, 8.46 × 10-5 mol) was dissolved in 3 mL DMF in a 4-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated at a rate of 5 °C /min to 130 °C in a programmable oven, held at this temperature for 48 h, then cooled at a rate of 0.4 ?C/min to room temperature. After removal of mother liquor from the mixture, chloroform (3 mL) was added to the vial. Colorless cubic crystals of ZIF-7 were collected from the upper layer, washed with DMF (3 mL × 3) and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.015 g, 37% based on H-PhIM).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-8 sod) : Zn(MeIM)2·(DMF)·(H2O)3. A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.210 g, 8.03 × 10-4 mol) and 2-methylimidazole (H-MeIM) (0.060 g, 7.31 × 10-4 mol) was dissolved in 18 mL DMF in a 20-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated at a rate of 5 °C /min to 140 °C in a programmable oven, held at this temperature for 24 h, then cooled at a rate of 0.4 ?C/min to room temperature. After removal of mother liquor from the mixture, chloroform (20 mL) was added to the vial. Colorless polyhedral crystals of the product were collected from the upper layer, washed with DMF (10 mL × 3) and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.032 g, 25% based on H-MeIM).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-9 sod) : Co(PhIM)2·(DMF)(H2O). A solid mixture of cobalt nitrate hexahydrate Co(NO3)2·6H2O (0.210 g, 7.21 × 10-4 mol) and benzimidazole (H-PhIM) (0.060 g, 5.08 × 10-4 mol) was dissolved in 18 mL DMF in a 20-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated at a rate of 5 °C /min to 130 °C in a programmable oven, held at this temperature for 48 h, then cooled at a rate of 0.4 ?C/min to room temperature. Purple cubic crystals thus produced were washed with DMF (3 mL × 3) and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.030 g, 30% based on H-PhIM)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-10 mer) : Zn(IM)2. A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.010 g, 3.82 × 10-5 mol) and imidazole (H-IM) (0.030 g, 4.41 × 10-4 mol) was dissolved in 3 mL DMF in a 4-mL vial. The vial was capped and heated for 4 d in an isothermal oven at 85 °C. The reaction mixture was then allowed to cool to room temperature naturally. Several block-shape crystals of ZIF-10 formed on the wall and bottom, and were separated by hand and collected for single crystal X-ray structure determination.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-11 rho) Zn(PhIM)2·(DEF)0.9. A solid mixture of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.60 g, 2.3 × 10-3 mol) and benzimidazole (H-PhIM) (4.2 g, 3.5 × 10-2 mol) was dissolved in 360 mL DEF in a 500-mL wide-mouth glass jar. The capped jar was heated for 4 d in an isothermal oven at 100 °C. The jar was then removed from the oven, and allowed to cool to room temperature naturally. Cubic colorless crystals formed on the walls of the jar along with a crystalline powder at the bottom. Although the powder and crystals were proven to be the same phase by powder X-ray diffraction, only the crystals on the wall were used for bulk characterizations. The powder and mother liquor was removed by repeating the cycle of decanting, washing with DMF and sonicating several times. Colorless crystals of ZIF-11 were collected by filtration, washed with DMF (200 mL × 2) and dried in the air (30 min) (yield: 0.21 g, 23% based on Zn(NO3)2·4H2O).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-12 rho) : Co(PhIM)2. A solid mixture of cobalt nitrate hexahydrate Co(NO3)2·6H2O (0.010 g, 3.44 × 10-5 mol) and benzimidazole (H-PhIM) (0.030 g, 2.54 × 10-4 mol) was dissolved in 3 mL DEF in a 4-mL vial. The capped vial was heated for 2 d in an isothermal oven at 130 °C. The reaction mixture was then allowed to cool to room temperature naturally. Several cubic crystals of ZIF-12 formed at the bottom and on the wall of the vial, and they were collected for single crystal X-ray structure determination.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-2 crb): Zn(IM)2. 0.265 mL imidazole stock solution (0.150 M, 3.98 × 10-5 mol) and 0.035 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.075 M, 2.63 × 10-6 mol). The product was in the form of small rod-shaped single crystals.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-6 gis): Zn(IM)2. 0.257 mL imidazole stock solution (0.150 M, 3.86 × 10-5 mol) and 0.043 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.075 M, 3.23 × 10-6 mol). The product was in the form of large inter-grown blocks, which could be cut into small single crystals under an optical microscope.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-5 gar) : In2Zn3(IM)12 Indium nitrate pentahydrate, In(NO3)3·5H2O (0.156 g, 4.0 × 10-4 mol), zinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.026 g, 1.0 × 10-4 mmol) and imidazole (H-IM) (0.136 g, 2 × 10-3 mol) were dissolved in a mixed solvent of DEF/n-butanol (4 mL/2 mL,). After the addition of tetraethylammonium hydroxide (0.05 mL, 35% aqueous solution), the mixture was transferred into a Teflon-lined Parr stainless steel vessel (23 mL) and heated at 150 °C for 72 hours under autogenous pressure. Pale-yellow crystals thus produced were washed with ethanol and dried in air (yield: 70%, based on zinc nitrate tetrahydrate).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of NU-109E. Cu(NO3)2.2.5H2O (76 mg, 327 μmol) and acid ligand LH6-1 (40 mg, 39.4 μmol) were dissolved in DMF (1.6 ml). Then DMF (8 ml), EtOH (8 ml) and HCl (6 drops) were added to this mixture. This solution (17.6 ml) was divided into four 6-dram vials (VWR, catalog # 66011-143). The vials were capped and placed into an oven at 75 °C for 48 h. The resulting teal crystals were washed with DMF without drying. Yield calculated from evacuated sample = 50 % based on LH6-1.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of NU-110E. Cu(NO3)2.2.5H2O (38 mg, 163 μmol) and acid ligand LH6-2 (20 mg, 18.7 μmol) were dissolved in DMF (0.8 ml). Then DMF (4 ml), EtOH (4 ml) and HCl (3 drops) were added to this mixture. This solution (8.8 ml) was divided into two 6-dram vials (VWR, catalog # 66011-143). The vials were capped and placed into an oven at 80 °C for 48 h. The resulting teal crystals were washed with DMF without drying. Yield calculated from evacuated sample = 45% based on LH6-2.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:MOF-2: Anhydrous ZnCl2 (3.0 g) and p-benzenedicaboxylic acid (H2BDC) (2.15 g) were dissolved by vigorous stirring into dimethylformamide (DMF) (250 mL). A solution of distilled water (100 mL) and 40 wt% aqueous methylamine (3.6 mL) was added drop-wise over 15 minutes to partially titrate the clear, stirring DMF solution. After 1 day of sitting at room temperature the clear block crystals were filtered and washed with DMF. The filtered crystals were evacuated to 10-3 torr and heated to 60 °C in 30 minutes, then to 150 °C in 2 hours, and held at that temperature for 6 hours to give a 345 m2/g sample. Norit RB2: The carbon sample was evacuated and heated at 300 °C for 5 hours to give a 1,184 m2/g sample. MOF-505 was prepared and activated according to published procedure (Chen, B.L. et al Angew. Chem. Int. Ed., 2005, 44, 4745) to give a 1,547 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:MOF-74: Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.250 g) and 2,5-dihydroxybenzenedicarboxylic acid (H2DHBDC) (0.100 g) were dissolved in a 20 mL vial containing DMF (10 mL), 1-propanol (0.5 mL) and distilled H2O (0.5 mL), capped, and heated at 100 °C for 20 hours. The crystals were washed with DMF, then immersed in 300 mL methanol. And the supernatant refreshed twice in two days to exchange the DMF guests. The crystals were evacuated to 10-3 torr and heated to 270 °C for 16 hours to produce an 816 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Cu3(BTC)2: Cu(NO3)2·2.5H2O (10.0 g) and 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (H3BTC) (5.0 g) were stirred for 10 minutes in 250 mL of solvent consisting of DMF, ethanol and water (1:1:1) in a 1 L jar to form a slurry. The tightly capped vessel was heated at 85 °C for 20 hours. The blue crystals were washed with DMF and exchanged with dichloromethane (CH2Cl2) thrice in three days. The dark blue crystals were then filtered and evacuated at 170 °C for 24 hours to give a 1,781 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:IRMOF-11: Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (3.00 g) and hydropyrenedicarboxylic acid (H2HPDC) (0.50 g) were dissolved in DEF (100 mL) in a 1 L jar, capped tightly, and heated to 100 °C for 20 hours. The solution was decanted and the brown block crystals were rinsed with DMF and exchanged with chloroform (CHCl3) thrice in three days. The material was evacuated at 125 °C for 6 hours to give a 2,096 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:IRMOF-3: Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (6.945 g) and 2-aminobenzenedicarboxylic acid (H2NH2BDC) (0.966 g) were dissolved in a 1 L jar containing DEF (300 mL). The solution was degassed via bubbling N2 for 10 minutes, then tightly capped and heated to 85 °C for 4 days. The solution was decanted, then the brown block crystals were washedin DMF and exchanged with CHCl3 thrice in three days. The material was evacuated at 125 °C for 6 h to give a 2,160 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:IRMOF-6: Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (9.00 g) and cyclobutylbenzenedicarboxylic acid (H2C2H4BDC) (2.50 g) were dissolved in DEF (300 mL) and then filtered into a 1 L jar which was capped tightly and heated to 100 °C for 20 hours. The solution was decanted, and the light yellow block crystals were washed in DMF and exchanged with CHCl3 thrice in three days. The material was evacuated at 125 °C for 6 hours to give a 2,516 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:IRMOF-1: Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.832 g) and H2BDC (0.176 g) were dissolved in DEF (10 mL) in a 20 mL vial, capped tightly, and heated to 100 °C for 20 hours. The solution was decanted, and the clear block crystals were washed in DMF and exchanged with CHCl3 thrice in three days. The material was evacuated at 125 °C for 6 hours to give a 2,833 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:MOF-177: Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.368 g) and 4,4',4''-benzene-1,3,5-triyl-tribenzoic acid (H3BTB) (0.180 g) were dissolved in DEF (10 mL) in a 20 mL vial, capped tightly, and heated to 100 °C for 20 hours. The solution was decanted, and the clear block crystals were washed in DMF and exchanged with CHCl3 thrice in three days. The material was evacuated at 125 °C for 6 hours to give a 4,508 m2/g sample.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The optimized synthesis of CAU-1 in the 24-reactor system is as follows: a mixture of AlCl3·6H2O (92.7 mg, 0.384 mmol) and H2N-H2bdc (23.32 mg, 0.129 mmol) was suspended in methanol (1.235 mL) and heated at 125 °C for 5 h. Scale-up of the reaction to the gram scale was performed in a 250 mL Duran screw-cap glass bottle (Schott). H2N-H2bdc (2.33?g, 12.9?mmol) and AlCl3·6H2O (9.27 g, 38.4 mmol) were suspended in methanol (123 mL). The resulting dispersion was heated at 125 °C for 5 h.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:a ) Conventional solvothermal reaction1,3,5-benzenetrisbenzoic acid (H3BTB) (200 mg, 0.46 mmol) and Bi(NO3)3·5H2O(148 mg, 0.31 mmol) were mixed in a 23 ml Teflon lined steel reactor, to which methanol (99.8%) (10 ml) was added. The reactor was then sealed, the reaction mixturehomogenized and heated to 120 °C for 12 h. The yellow precipitated was filtered, washedwith methanol, dimethylformamide (DMF) and methanol again. The product wasidentified by X-ray powder diffraction as pure CAU-7. (yield 67% based on H3BTB)(Figure S1)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:b) Conventional solvothermal reaction for larger crystals suitable for electron diffraction1,3,5-benzenetrisbenzoic acid (H3BTB) (200 mg, 0.46 mmol) of and Bi(NO3)3·5H2O(148 mg, 0.31 mmol) were added into a 23 ml Teflon lined steel reactor, to whichmethanol (99.8%) (7.5 ml) and DMF (2.5 ml) were added. The reactor was then sealed,the reaction mixture homogenized and heated to 120 °C for 12 h. The yellow precipitatedwas filtered, washed with methanol, DMF and methanol again. The product was identifiedas CAU-7 with a minor impurities (marked with * in Figure S1) by X-ray powderdiffraction. (yield 73% based on H3BTB)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:c) Synthesis under microwave assisted heating1,3,5-benzenetrisbenzoic acid (H3BTB) (200 mg, 0.46 mmol) and Bi(NO3)3·5H2O(148 mg, 0.31 mmol) were mixed into 30 ml microwave glass reaction vessel (Biotage) towhich methanol (99.8%) (20 ml) methanol was added. The reactor was sealed with aseptum, the reaction mixture homogenized and heated to 120 °C for 20 min in a BiotageInitiator microwave synthesizer. The mixture was stirred with a magnetic stirring barduring the reaction. The yellow precipitated was filtered, washed with methanol, DMFand methanol again. The product was identified as pure CAU-7 by X-ray powderdiffraction. (Figure S1) (yield 72 % based on H3BTB)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Single-crystals of CAU-8 suitable in size for the structure determination (Figure 1) were isolated during the HT optimization experiments from a 2 mL-reactor. These were accompanied by a microcrystalline, unporous byproduct. In this experiment, 60 mg of H2BPDC (0.22 mmol), 148 mg of Al2(SO4)3·18H2O (0.22 mmol), 250 μL of DMF, and 250 μL of H2O were heated in a HT-reactor up to 140 °C over 1 h, held at this temperature for 12 h, and cooled down to room temperature over 1 h.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CAU-10-H (1) was synthesized from a mixture of 200 mg of 1,3-H2BDC (1.20 mmol), 800 mg of Al2(SO4)3·18H2O (1.20 mmol), 1 mL of N,N-dimethylformamid (DMF), and 4 mL of H2O. The reactants were dosed into a Teflon-lined steel-autoclave with a volume of 37 mL and placed in an oven for 12 h at 135 °C. After being cooled to room temperature, the product was filtered off and the obtained solid was redispersed in water by sonication and stirring, until a homogeneous mixture was obtained. The dispersion was filtered again and the white microcrystalline solid was dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The methylated MOF CAU-10-CH3 (2) was synthesized in a 100 mL glass reactor with screw cap. Therefore, 0.80 g (4.44 mmol) of 5-methylisophthalic acid, 2.96 g of Al2(SO4)3·18H2O (4.44 mmol), 4 mL of DMF, and 16 mL of H2O were mixed thoroughly and heated for 12 h to 130 °C. After cooling to room temperature, the filtered product was redispersed in ?200 mL water by sonication and stirring. Afterward, the mixture was filtered again and the pale yellow solid was dried under ambient conditions.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The OCH3-functionalized MOF CAU-10-OCH3 (3) was also synthesized in a 100 mL glass reactor with screw cap: 1.20 g (6.12 mmol) of 5-methoxyisophthalic acid, 2.04 g of Al2(SO4)3·18H2O (3.06 mmol), 3 mL of DMF, and 12 mL of H2O were mixed thoroughly and heated for 12 h at 130 °C. After being cooled to room temperature, the white microcrystalline product was processed in the same way as CAU-10-CH3.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The NO2-functionalized CAU-10-NO2 (4) was synthesized using a 2 M solution of AlCl3·6H2O in water as the Al3+ source. Thus, 1440 mg (6.82 mmol) 5-nitroisophthalic acid, 3.4 mL of Al3+ solution (6.80 mmol), 4 mL of DMF, and 12.6 mL of H2O were filled into a 100 mL glass reactor with screw cap. The mixture was heated at 120 °C for 12 h, and the product was worked up in the same way as the other compounds.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The NH2-functionalized CAU-10-NH2 (5) was synthesized by dosing 1200 mg (6.63 mmol) of 5-aminoisophthalic acid, 3.3 mL of Al3+-solution (6.6 mmol), 4 mL of DMF, and 12.7 mL of H2O into a 100 mL glass reactor with screw cap. The mixture was heated at 120 °C for 12 h, and the resulting pale pink solid was filtered off. The reaction product was redipersed in water by sonication for 30 min, filtered off again and dried for one hour at 200 °C in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The OH-functionalized CAU-10-OH (6) was synthesized by dosing 1000 mg (5.49 mmol) of 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid, 2.8 mL of Al3+-solution (5.6 mmol), 4 mL of DMF and 13.2 mL of H2O into a 100 mL glass reactor with screw cap. The mixture was heated at 120 °C for 12 h, and the resulting white solid was filtered off. The reaction product was redipersed in water by sonication for 30 min, filtered off again and dried for 1 h at 200 °C in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The optimized synthesis parameters obtained from the HT-investigations were used for the synthesis scale up of CAU-11. CAU-11 is synthesized from a mixture of AlCl3·6H2O (724 mg, 3 mmol), 4,4′-sulfonyldibenzoic acid (H2SDBA) (268 mg, 1.2 mmol), 2 M aqueous solution of NaOH (1.8 mL, 3.6 mmol), and 18.2 mL of H2O (no homogenization was necessary). The Teflon-liner was placed in a steel autoclave with a volume of 30 mL. The reaction was performed under conventional heating at 150 °C for 12 h, with 1 h heating up and 1 h cooling down. To remove free linker molecules as detected by IR spectroscopy, the resulting precipitate was filtered off and washed with DMF under microwave heating at 150 °C for 1 h. After being cooled to room temperature, the solid was filtered and dried in air. Yield ?420 mg (?98% based on H2SDBA). Elemental analysis: N 0.82%, C 46.63%, H 2.70%, S 8.41%. Calculated values based on the molecular formula [Al(OH)(SDBA)]·0.25DMF: N 0.96%, C 48.33%, H 2.94%, S 8.74%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CAU-11-COOH could only be obtained in the miniaturized reactors. CAU-11-COOH was synthesized in a 5 mL glass vial from a mixture of DPSDA (53.7 mg, 0.15 mmol), 1 M aqueous solution of AlCl3·6H2O (75 μL, 0.15 mmol), and 1425 μL of H2O (no homogenization was necessary). The reaction was carried out in a HT-microwave oven at 170 °C for 5 h. After cooling to room temperature, the precipitate was filtered off and dried in air. Yield ?35 mg (?50% based on DPSDA). Elemental analysis: C 43.23%, H 2.04%, S 7.46%. Calculated values based on the molecular formula [Al(OH)(H2DPSTC)]·0.5H2O: C 45.60%, H 2.88%, S 7.60%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CAU-12 was synthesized using a large excess of Al3+ ions in a mixture of DPSDA (17.9 mg, 0.05 mmol), 1000 μL of H2O, and 1 M aqueous solution of Al(NO3)3·9H2O (500 μL, 0.5 mmol). The starting materials were placed in a 5 mL glass vial, and the reaction was carried out in a HT-microwave oven at 170 °C for 5 h. After cooling to room temperature, the precipitate was filtered off and dried in air. Upscaling of the reaction was not yet achieved. Yield ?20 mg (?85% based on DPSDA). Elemental analysis: C 37.32%, H 2.29%, S 5.84%. Calculated values based on the molecular formula [Al2(OH)2(DPSTC)(H2O)2]·0.5H2O: C 36.72%, H 2.50%, S 6.13%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-17. All chemicals were purchased and obtained from Aldrich, Alfa Aesar, or BASF. They were used without further purification. Synthesis was carried out under solvothermal conditions in a Biotage Initiator microwave oven with 10 mL vials. Suitable single crystals were obtained by mixing H3BTC (62.5 mg, 297 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5H2O (125.5 mg, 259 μmol) with 5 mL of MeOH at room temperature. The sealed glass vial was shaken by hand for 1 min and subsequently heated in the microwave oven to 120 °C for 20 min with 600 rpm stirring. The obtained colorless single crystals were collected by filtration.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CAU-18 H6TCPP (20 mg, 2.53 × 10–2 mmol), DMF (1200 μL), H2O (300 μL), and 0.53 M aqueous (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] solution (94 μL, 5.06 × 10–2 mmol) were added to a 7.0 mL glass vial. The glass vial was heated for 2 h at 100 °C. The resulting product was filtered off and washed two times each with DMF and acetone. A yield of 63 mg (79% based on H6TCPP) was obtained for CAU-18, [Ce4(H2TCPP)3(DMF)2(H2O)4].

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CAU-19-H H6TCPP (20 mg, 2.53 × 10–2 mmol), benzoic acid (HBA-H) (570 mg, 4.67 mmol), DMF (1200 μL), H2O (300 μL), and 0.53 M aqueous (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] solution (94 μL, 5.06 × 10–2 mmol) were added to a 7.0 mL glass vial. The glass vial was heated for 24 h at 120 °C. The resulting product was filtered off and washed two times each with DMF and acetone. A yield of 16 mg, 56% (based on H6TCPP) was obtained for CAU-19-H, [Ce3(H2TCPP)2(BA-H)(HBA-H/H2O)2]·2(HBA-H)·11H2O.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Zn-CAU-19-H H6TCPP (20 mg, 2.53 × 10–2 mmol), ZnSO4 (5 mg, 3.10 × 10–2 mmol), benzoic acid (HBA-H) (570 mg, 4.67 mmol), DMF (1200 μL), H2O (300 μL), and 0.53 M aqueous (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] solution (94 μL, 5.06 × 10–2 mmol) were added to a 7.0 mL glass vial. The glass vial was heated for 1 h at 120 °C under stirring. The resulting product was filtered off and washed two times each with DMF and acetone. A yield of 15 mg, 53% (based on H6TCPP) was obtained for Zn-CAU-19-H, [Ce3(Zn-TCPP)2(BA-H)(HBA-H/H2O)2]·2(HBA-H)·8H2O.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Co-CAU-19-H Co-H4TCPP (20 mg, 2.53 × 10–2 mmol), benzoic acid (HBA-H) (570 mg, 4.67 mmol), DMF (2400 μL), H2O (350 μL), and 0.53 M aqueous (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] solution (94 μL, 12.65 × 10–2 mmol) were added to a 7.0 mL glass vial. The glass vial was heated for 2 h at 120 °C under stirring. The resulting product was filtered off and washed two times each with DMF and acetone. A yield of 12 mg, 42% (based on Co–H4TCPP) was obtained for Co-CAU-19-H, [Ce3(Co-TCPP)2(BA-H)(HBA-H/H2O)2]·2(HBA-H)·11H2O.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Ce-PMOF-4NO2 H6TCPP (180 mg, 22.77 × 10–2 mmol), 4-nitrobenzoic acid (HBA-4NO2) (2000 mg, 12.05 mmol), DMF (9000 μL), and 0.53 M aqueous (NH4)2[Ce(NO3)6] solution (850 μL, 45.54 × 10–2 mmol) were added to a 30 mL Teflon vessel. The Teflon vessel was placed in an autoclave and was heated for 48 h at 120 °C. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with 100 mL DMF. A yield of 139 mg, 44% (based on H6TCPP) was obtained for Ce-PMOF-4NO2, [Ce2(H2TCPP)(BA-4NO2)2]·2DMF.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized Reaction Conditions and Scale-Up Synthesis for CAU-21-BPDC (1)The HT synthesis optimization led to the following optimized synthesis procedure: to a mixture of 129.6 μL of 2 M Al(NO3)3·9H2O in H2O (259 μmol), 70 mg 4,4′-benzophenonedicarboxylic acid (H2BPDC, 259 μmol), and 10 mg benzoic acid (HBA, 82 μmol) were added 300 μL of N,N-dimethylformamide (3.86 mmol) and 70.4 μL of deionized water (5.36 mmol). The reactor was sealed and heated to 110 °C within 6 h, held at this temperature for 24 h, and then cooled to room temperature within 72 h. The product was filtered off, washed with N,N-dimethylformamide at 65 °C for 3 h, filtered again, and subsequently activated at 200 °C at 10–2 kPa for 48 h. The additional washing step in DMF is necessary because the raw product contains recrystallized linker molecules.Larger amounts of CAU-21-BPDC can be obtained using 648.2 μL of 2 M Al(NO3)3·9H2O in H2O (1.3 mmol), 350 mg of 4,4′-benzophenonedicarboxylic acid (H2BPDC, 1.3 mmol), 50 mg of benzoic acid (410 μmol), 1.5 mL of N,N-dimethylformamide (19.3 mmol), and 352 μL of deionized water (26.8 mmol) in a 30 mL Teflon lined steel autoclave. The temperature program and the additional washing and activation steps are the same as in the optimized synthesis conditions of CAU-21-BPDC (yield: 0.27 g, 66% based on H2BPDC).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Single Crystals of CAU-21-BPDC (1)Single crystals of CAU-21-BPDC suitable in size for a structure determination could be obtained during the HT optimization experiments from a 2 mL reactor (Figure 1). This synthesis batch also contained recrystallized linker molecules and crystals of CAU-8-BPDC. In this experiment 64.8 μL of 2 M Al(NO3)3·9H2O in H2O (185 μmol), 50 mg of H2BPDC (185 μmol), 250 μL of DMF, and 185.2 μL of H2O were heated in an HT reactor up to 145 °C over 1 h, held at this temperature for 12 h, and cooled to room temperature over 1 h.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The following synthesis conditions are the optimized ones for CAU-8-ODB: a reaction mixture of 107.7 mg of 4,4′-oxydibenzoic acid (H2ODB, 0.25 mmol), 53.3 mg of Al(NO3)3·9H2O (0.25 mmol), and 6.0 mL of DMF was heated at 120 °C in a 23 mL Teflon-lined digestion bomb for 2 days followed by slow cooling at 6 °C h–1 to room temperature. A pale yellow powder of 2 was filtered off, washed with N,N-dimethylformamide at 85 °C overnight, filtered again, and subsequently activated at 200 °C at 10–2 kPa for 16 h (yield: 20 mg, 25% based on H2ODB).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized Reaction Conditions and Scale-Up Synthesis for CAU-21-ODB (3)The HT synthesis optimization led to the following optimized synthesis procedure: to a mixture of 22.4 mg of AlCl3·6H2O (93 μmol) and 24 mg of 4,4′-oxydibenzoic acid (H2ODB, 93 μmol), and 400 μL of N,N-dimethylformamide (5.15 mmol) was added 100 μL of deionized water (5.55 mmol). The reactor was sealed carefully and heated to 170 °C within 1 h, held at this temperature for 12 h, and finally cooled to room temperature within 1 h. The product was filtered off, washed with N,N-dimethylformamide at 65 °C for 3 h, filtered again, and subsequently activated at 200 °C at 10–2 kPa for 48 h. The additional washing step in DMF is necessary because the raw filtered product contains recrystallized linker molecules. Larger amounts of CAU-21-ODB can be obtained using 336 mg of AlCl3·6H2O (1.4 mmol), 360 mg of 4,4′-oxydibenzoic acid (H2ODB, 1.4 mmol), 6 mL of N,N-dimethylformamide (77 mmol), and 1.5 mL of deionized water (83 mmol) in a 30 mL Teflon-lined steel autoclave. The temperature program and the additional washing and activation steps are the same as in the optimized synthesis conditions of CAU-21-ODB (yield: 92 mg, 23% based on H2ODB).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Solvothermal Synthesis of [Al(HODB)2(OH)] (4)A reaction mixture of 4,4′-oxydibenzoic acid (H2ODB, 0.2582 g, 0.1 mmol), aluminum chloride (AlCl3, 0.1334 g, 0.1 mmol), and H2O (5.0 mL) was heated at 120 °C for 2 days, followed by slow cooling at 6 °C h–1 to room temperature. The colorless and small crystals of [Al(HODB)2(OH)] were filtered off, washed with H2O and ethanol, and dried under ambient conditions.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Zr-CAU-24. All products were synthesized using Pyrex glass reaction tubes (maximumvolume 8 mL). 1,2,4,5-Tetrakis(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene (H4TCPB, 29.8 mg, 53.3 μmol) wasintroduced into the glass reactor. After the addition of N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF; 1.5 mL) andformic acid (99%, HCOOH, 1030 μL, 27.3 mmol) an aqueous solution of zirconium(IV) dinitrate oxidehydrate (500 μL, 0.5333 M) was added. The glass reactor was sealed and heated using an aluminum heaterblock under stirring for 15 min at 100 °C. The colorless precipitate was centrifuged in the mother liquor,which was then decanted off, before being re-dispersed and centrifuged twice in DMF (2 mL). To removeDMF from the product, the solid was washed and centrifuged with acetone (2 mL) four times. Theresulting white solid was dried in air at 70 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Ce-CAU-24. All products were synthesized using Pyrex glass reaction tubes (maximumvolume 8 mL). 1,2,4,5-Tetrakis(4-carboxyphenyl)benzene (H4TCPB, 29.8 mg, 53.3 μmol) wasintroduced into the glass reactor. After the addition of N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF; 1.2 mL) andformic acid (99%, HCOOH, 258 μL, 6.83 mmol) an aqueous solution of cerium(IV) ammonium nitrate(400 μL, 1.066 M) was added. The glass reactor was sealed and heated using an aluminum heater blockunder stirring for 15 min at 100 °C. The yellow precipitate was centrifuged in the mother liquor, whichwas then decanted off, before being re-dispersed and centrifuged twice in DMF (2 mL). To remove DMFfrom the product, the solid was washed and centrifuged with acetone (2 mL) four times. The resultingwhite solid was dried in air at 70 °C

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-26: 232.6 mg (1.40 mmol) terephthalic acid and 20 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE lined steel autoclave.Afterwards 0.892 mL (ca. 2 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid (15 to 17 wt% Zr) were added and the autoclave wassealed. The mixture was heated to 160 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 22 hours. After the reaction mixturecooled down to room temperature, 447.0 mg of a white solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent drying for 1 hour at 60 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-27-BDC: 232.6 mg (1.40 mmol) terephthalic acid and 20 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE lined steelautoclave. Afterwards 0.892 mL (ca. 2 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid (15 to 17 wt% Zr) were added and theautoclave was sealed. The mixture was heated to 220 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 238 hours. After thereaction mixture cooled down to room temperature, 526.8 mg of a white/greyish solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent dryingfor 1 hour at 60 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-27-BPDC: 339.1 mg (1.40 mmol) 4,4’-biphenyl-dicarboxylic acid and 20 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE linedsteel autoclave. Afterwards 0.892 mL (ca. 2 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid (15 to 17 wt% Zr) were added andthe autoclave was sealed. The mixture was heated to 220 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 238 hours. After thereaction mixture cooled down to room temperature, 675.9 mg of a white/greyish solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent dryingfor 1 hour at 60 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-27-BIPY: 341.9 mg (1.40 mmol) 5,5’-dicarboxy-2,2’-bipyridine and 20 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE linedsteel autoclave. Afterwards 0.892 mL (ca. 2 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid (15 to 17 wt% Zr) were added andthe autoclave was sealed. The mixture was heated to 220 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 238 hours. After thereaction mixture cooled down to room temperature, 509.6 mg of a white/greyish solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent dryingfor 1 hour at 60 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of UiO-67-BIPY: UiO-67-BIPY was prepared via a slightly adapted standard solvothermal method.[5] 1.27 mmol 5,5'-dicarboxy-2,2'-bipyridine was dissolved in 100 mL DMF in a 250 mL Schott bottle and sonicated for 15 min. Next, 1.27 mmol ZrCl4 wasadded, followed by 2.15 mL acetic acid and 0.5 mL 37% HCl. The mixture was then placed in an oven at 120 °C for 48 h. After MOFformation, the MOF was washed 3 times with DMF and 3 times with ethanol. After each washing step, the MOF mixture was centrifugedfor 30 min at 4000 rpm. Eventually, the MOF was dried overnight in an oven at 80 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized Reaction Conditions for Zr-CAU-28. In the system ZrOCl2·8H2O/H2FDC/2-propanol/acetic acid, the initial synthesis conditions were optimized. Subsequently, it was observed that 2-propanol can be readily replaced by equal volumes of water, water/2-propanol, and water/ethanol mixtures, respectively. While Zr-CAU-28 is always obtained (Figure 2), this affects the particle diameter as observed by dynamic light scattering (see Supporting Information, SI, Table S1 and Figures S1, S2). The optimized reaction system is ZrOCl2·8H2O/H2FDC/H2O/acetic acid. The most crystalline product is obtained by a microwave-assisted reaction of a mixture of 45 mg (0.28 mmol) of H2FDC, 60 mg (0.19 mmol) ZrOCl2·8H2O, 700 μL acetic acid, and 800 μL H2O. The reaction mixture was stirred for several minutes before being placed into the microwave oven at 80 °C for 1 h. The raw product was separated via centrifugation and washed in ethanol by redispersion and centrifugation. Yield: 55 mg (46% based on H2FDC) of a white crystalline powder of [Zr6O4(OH)4(FDC)4(OH)4(H2O)4]·nH2O with n ≈ 16 (elemental analysis measured: C: 16.71; H: 2.26; calculated: C: 16.72; H: 3.90).Figure 2Figure 2. PXRD patterns of Zr-CAU-28 synthesized using identical amounts of different solvents and solvent mixtures (a: ethanol/water; b: 2-propanol; c: water; and d: theoretical pattern) and employing acetic acid as modulator.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Ce-CAU-282,5-Furandicarboxylic acid (33.3 mg, 0.21 mmol) was introduced into a pyrex tube glass reactor. After the addition of 1.2 mL of DMF and formic acid (515 μL, 13.57 mmol), an aqueous 0.533 m solution of cerium(IV) ammonium nitrate (400 μL, 0.21 mmol) was added to the mixture. The glass reactor was sealed and heated under stirring for 15 min at 100 °C. The white precipitate was centrifuged in the mother liquor which was then decanted off before being redispersed and centrifuged twice in DMF (2 mL). To remove DMF from the product, the solid was subsequently washed and centrifuged with acetone (2 mL) four times. The resulting white solid was dried in air at 70 °C. Yield: 35 mg (29%). Elemental analysis for the as synthesized MOF Ce-CAU-28 [Ce6O4(OH)4(FDC)4(OH)4(H2O)4]·2DMF·2H2O: calculated: C 17.29%, H 1.62%, N 1.34%; measured: C 17.70%, H 1.57%, N 0.89%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Mn-CAU-29: Ni-H8TPPP (180 mg, 18.3 × 10-5 mmol), MnCl2·4 H2O(190.5 mg, 91.5 × 10-5 mmol) and H2O (12 mL) were added to a 30 mL Teflon insertand placed in a steel reactor. The reactor was heated for 48 h at 180 °C and cooled downto room temperature in 6 h. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with H2Oand acetone. A yield of 162 mg, (84 % based on Ni-H8TPPP) was obtained for Mn CAU-29, [Mn(Ni-H6TPPP)(H2O)]·7 H2O. Elemental analysis of Mn-CAU-29: calc(%): C 50.4, H 4.2, N 5.4, found (%): C 50.1, H 3.4, N 5.2.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Co-CAU-29: Ni-H8TPPP (180 mg, 18.3 × 10-5 mmol), CoCl2·6 H2O(229.2 mg, 91.5 × 10-5 mmol) and H2O (12 mL) were added to a 30 mL Teflon insertand placed in a steel reactor. The reactor was heated for 48 h at 180 °C and cooled downto room temperature in 6 h. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with H2Oand acetone. A yield of 156 mg, (81 % based on Ni-H8TPPP) was obtained for Co-CAU 29, [Co(Ni- H6TPPP)(H2O)]·5 H2O. Elemental analysis of Co-CAU-29: calc (%):C 49.2, H 3.8, N 5.2, found (%): C 49.3, H 3.3, N 5.1.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Ni-CAU-29: Ni-H8TPPP (180 mg, 18.3 × 10-5 mmol), NiCl2·6 H2O(228.9 mg, 91.5 × 10-5 mmol) and H2O (12 mL) were added to a 30 mL Teflon insertand placed in a steel reactor. The reactor was heated for 48 h at 180 °C and cooled downto room temperature in 6 h. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with H2Oand acetone. A yield of 165 mg, (86 % based on Ni-H8TPPP) was obtained for Ni-CAU 29, [Ni(Ni- H6TPPP)(H2O)]·5 H2O. Elemental analysis of Ni-CAU-29: calc (%):C 49.2, H 3.8, N 5.2, found (%): C 49.3, H 3.4, N 5.1.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Cd-CAU-29: Ni-H8TPPP (180 mg, 18.3 × 10-5 mmol), CdCl2·H2O(193.8 mg, 91.5 × 10-5 mmol) and H2O (12 mL) were added to a 30 mL Teflon insertand placed in a steel reactor. The reactor was heated for 48 h at 180 °C and cooled downto room temperature in 6 h. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with H2Oand acetone. A yield of 180 mg, (89 % based on Ni-H8TPPP) was obtained for Cd-CAU 29, [Cd(Ni- H6TPPP)(H2O)]·7 H2O. Elemental analysis of Ni-CAU-29: calc (%):C 47.8, H 4.0, N 5.1, found (%): C 47.7, H 3.2, N 4.9

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Zr-CAU-30 Ni-H8TPPP (15.0 mg, 15.9 × 10-3 mmol), ZrOCl2·8H2O (9.8 mg, 33.0 × 10-3 mmol), NaF (38.2 mg, 9.6 × 10-1 mmol), H2O (3000 μL), 2 M aqueous solution NaOH (60.6 μL, 12.9 × 10-2 mmol) were added to a 5 mL glass vial and placed in a reaction block on a heating plate. The block was heated for 3 h at 160 °C under stirring. The resulting product was centrifuged at 6000 rpm for 10 min and washed once with H2O and acetone each. A yield of 6.7 mg was obtained which consist of a mixture of ZrO2 and Zr-CAU-30, [Zr2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·23H2O.Elemental analysis of Zr-CAU-30 [Zr2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·23H2O: calc. (%): C 30.1, H 5.9, N 3.2, found (%): C 28.5, H 3.3, N 3.0. Elemental analysis of a one to one mixture of ZrO2 and [Zr2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·23H2O: calc. (%): C 28.9, H 5.0, N 3.1, found (%): C 28.5, H 3.3, N 3.0.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Hf-CAU-30 Ni-H8TPPP (15.0 mg, 15.9 × 10-3 mmol), HfCl4 (9.7 mg, 3.3 × 10-2 mmol), NaF (38.2 mg, 9.6 × 10-1 mmol), H2O (3000 μL), 2 M aqueous solution NaOH (60.6 μL, 12.9 × 10-2 mmol) were added to a 5 mL glass vial and placed in a reaction block on a heating plate. The block was heated for 3 h at 160 °C under stirring. The resulting product was centrifuged at 6000 rpm for 10 min and washed once with H2O and acetone each. A yield of 7.0 mg was obtained which consist of a mixture of HfO2 and Hf-CAU-30, [Hf2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·30H2O.Elemental analysis of Hf-CAU-30 [Hf2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·30H2O: calc. (%): C 29.0, H 5.0, N 3.1, found (%): C 24.9, H 3.5, N 2.6.Elemental analysis of a one to one mixture of HfO2 and [Hf2(Ni-H2TPPP)(OH/F)2]·30H2O: calc. (%): C 24.3, H 4.2, N 2.6, found (%): C 24.9, H 3.5, N 2.6.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized synthesis of [Bi2(H2TCPB)(TCPB)(H2O)2]·xH2O (CAU-31): To a mixture of H4TCPB (5 mg, 8.95 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5H2O (4.3 mg, 8.95 μmol) in a 2 mL PTFE liner, 1 mL of CH3OH was added. The sealed reactor was shaken for 10 min and heated in an oven to 80 °C over 1 h and kept at this temperature for 12 h. After being cooled over 1 h to room temperature, the solid product was filtered off and washed with CH3OH. A white powder was obtained in a yield of 5.5 mg. The reaction was repeated several times, to obtain a suitable amount for detailed characterization. Phase purity was confirmed by PXRD (Figure S3) and elemental analysis (calculated (%) for [Bi2(O8C34H20)(O8C34H18)(H2O)2]·15.5H2O: C 44.3 H 4.0; measured (%): C 44.2 H 3.6).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized synthesis of (NH2(CH3)2)[Bi(TCPB)(H2O)]·xH2O (CAU-32): To a mixture of H4TCPB (10 mg, 17.9 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5H2O (8.7 mg, 17.9 μmol) in a 2 mL PTFE liner, 800 μL of CH3OH and 200 μL of DMF were added. The sealed reactor was shaken for 10 min and heated in an oven to 100 °C over 1 h and kept at this temperature for 12 h. After being cooled over 1 h to room temperature, the solid product was filtered off and washed with CH3OH. A white powder was obtained in a yield of 15.3 mg. The reaction was repeated several times, to obtain a suitable amount for detailed characterization. Phase purity was confirmed by PXRD (Figure S15) and elemental analysis (calculated (%) for (NH2(CH3)2)[Bi(O8C34H18)(H2O)]·4H2O: C 48.1 H 4.0 N 1.6; measured (%): C 48.5 H 3.8 N 1.2).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized synthesis of [Bi4(O)2(OH)2(H2TCPB)(TCPB)(H2O)2]·xH2O (β-CAU-33): To a mixture of H4TCPB (10 mg, 17.9 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5H2O (17.4 mg, 35.8 μmol) in a 2 mL PTFE liner, 450 μL of DMF and 50 μL of toluene were added. The sealed reactor was shaken for 10 min and heated in an oven to 120 °C over 1 h and kept at this temperature for 12 h. After being cooled over 1 h to room temperature, the solid product was filtered off. The product was afterward stirred in a 1:1 mixture of CH3OH/DMF at 100 °C for 10 min, washed with CH3OH, and dried at 60 °C for 1 h. A white powder was obtained in a yield of 13.7 mg. The reaction was repeated several times, to obtain a suitable amount for detailed characterization. Phase purity was confirmed by PXRD (Figure S9) and elemental analysis (calculated (%) for [Bi4(O)2(OH)2(O8C34H20)(O8C34H18)(H2O)2]·7H2O·DMF: C 37.9 H 2.9 N 0.6; measured (%): C 37.9 H 2.7 N 0.7).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of [Bi(TATB)] (CAU-7-TATB) H3TATB (30.0 mg, 68.0 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5 H2O (28.7 mg, 59.2 μmol) were mixed in a 30 mL glass vial and MeOH (6 mL) and DMF (6 mL) were added. The sealed vial was shaken and heated during microwave-assisted synthesis at 120 °C for 20 min under stirring at 600 rpm. The solid product was filtered off and washed with DMF (5 mL) and MeOH (5 mL). A white powder was obtained in a yield of 30.8 mg (55% based on H3TATB). The phase purity was confirmed via PXRD (Fig. S1?) and elemental analysis (calc. (%) for BiC24H12N3O6·C3H7NO·6H2O: C 39.14, H 3.77, N 6.76; meas. (%): C 37.29, H 2.93, N 7.84).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of [Bi(TATB-NH2)] (CAU-7-TATB-NH2) H3TATB-NH2 (100 mg, 219 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5 H2O (76.8 mg, 158 μmol) were mixed in a 30 mL glass vial and MeOH (10 mL) and DMF (10 mL) were added. The sealed vial was shaken and heated during microwave-assisted synthesis at 120 °C for 20 min under stirring at 600 rpm. The solid product was filtered off and washed with DMF (5 mL) and MeOH (5 mL). A yellow powder was obtained in a yield of 118 mg (68% based on H3TATB-NH2). The phase purity was confirmed by PXRD (Fig. S10?) and elemental analysis (calc. (%) for BiC24H13N4O6·0.5C3H7NO·5H2O: C 38.82, H 3.39, N 7.99; meas. (%): C 39.74, H 1.85, N 7.99).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of [Bi2(O)(OH)(TATB)] (CAU-35) H3TATB (5.0 mg, 11.3 μmol) and ground Bi(NO3)3·5 H2O (5.5 mg, 11.3 μmol) were mixed in a 2 mL PTFE insert, and H2O (800 μL) and DMF (200 μL) were added. The autoclave was sealed and heated to 120 °C for 12 h. The temperature was kept for 36 h, and subsequently, the reactor was slowly cooled down to room temperature in 60 h. The solid product was filtered off and washed with DMF (1 mL) and H2O (1 mL). A white powder was obtained. The phase purity was confirmed via PXRD (Fig. S17?) and elemental analysis (calc. (%) for Bi2C24H13N3O8·H2O: C 31.77, H 1.67, N 4.63; meas. (%): C 32.77, H 1.41, N 4.97).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized synthesis of Co-CAU-36: Ni-H8TPPP (5.0 mg, 5.3 × 10-3 mmol), CoCl2·6 H2O (1.3 mg, 5.3 × 10-3 mmol), DABCO (30 mg, 265.5 × 10-3 mmol), H2O (1000 μL) and 2M aqueous HCl solution (10.7 μL, 21.2 × 10-3 mmol) were added to a 2 mL Teflon insert and placed in the high-throughput reactor. The reactor was heated for 12 h at 160 °C and cooled down to RT in 6 h. The resulting product was filtered off and washed with H2O and acetone. A yield of 6.0 mg (75 % based on Ni-H8TPPP) was obtained for Co-CAU-36, [Co2(Ni-TPPP)]?2DABCO?15H2O. Elemental analysis of Co-CAU-36: calc (%): C 43.7, H 5.5, N 7.3, found (%): C 43.9, H 5.2, N 8.6.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of the Ce-UiO-66 type compoundsThe different linker molecules d-, l- and dl-aspartic acid (d-, l- and dl-H2ASP), 2-methylsucininic acid (H2MS) and 2,3-dimethylsucininic acid (H2DMS) were dissolved in distilled water and were introduced into the glass reactor. After the addition of the formic acid (HCOOH) and aqueous solution of cerium(iv) ammonium nitrate (0.5333 mol L?1) the reactor was sealed and the reaction was carried out (Table 1). The glass reactor was heated under stirring for 30 min at 100 °C. The obtained product was separated by centrifugation from the mother liquor, which was then decanted off. The product was re-dispersed and centrifuged twice in acetone and dried in air at 70 °C. Before characterization, Ce-UiO-66-ASP, [Ce6(μ3-O)4(μ3-OH)4(H2O)6(dl-ASP)6], was treated for 24 h in 0.2 M HCl and thereafter in acetone for 24 h under stirring at room temperature, respectively and dried in air at 70 °C. The same procedure was performed with the compounds Ce-UiO-66-d-ASP, [Ce6(μ3-O)4(μ3-OH)4(H2O)6(d-ASP)6] and Ce-UiO-66-l-ASP, [Ce6(μ3-O)4(μ3-OH)4(H2O)6(l-ASP)6]. The MOFs Ce-UiO-66-MS and Ce-UiO-66-DMS were treated in acetone for 24 h under stirring at room temperature and dried in air at 70 °C.Table 1 Overview of the optimized synthesis conditions for the title compounds. The concentration of the aqueous solution of cerium(iv) ammonium nitrate is 0.5333 mol L?1. The yield, based on cerium, of each MOF is also given in the last columnCompound Ce Ratio HCOOH Ce [mL] Linker [mg] H2O [mL] HCOOH [μL] Yield [%]Linker 0.533 M Ce-UiO-66-dl-ASP 1 1.5 145 3 319 9 8760 86Ce-UiO-66-d-ASP 1 1.5 145 3 319 9 8760 84Ce-UiO-66-l-ASP 1 1.5 145 3 319 9 8760 89Ce-UiO-66-MS 1 11 0 3 2325 9 0 86Ce-UiO-66-DMS 1 2.0 25 2 312 6 1006 70Ce-CAU-41 1 8.5 10 2 2142 12 804 92Ce-CAU-44 1 3.5 0 2 936 12 0 97Synthesis of CAU-41 and CAU-44The linker succinic acid was (H2SUC) dissolved in distilled water and introduced into the glass reactor. After the addition of the formic acid (HCOOH only for CAU-41) and the aqueous solution of cerium(iv) ammonium nitrate (0.5333 M) the reactor was sealed and the reaction was carried out (Table 1). The glass reactor was heated up under stirring for 30 min at 100 °C. The obtained product was centrifuged from the mother liquor, which was then decanted off. Afterwards the product was re-dispersed and centrifuged twice in acetone and dried in air at 70 °C. Before the characterization the compounds were treated in acetone for 24 h under stirring at room temperature and dried in air at 70 °C.

paragraph: Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized syntheses:((CH3)2NH2)2[Al3O(HHTP)(HHTP·)]·0.5DMF·18H2O: 32.4 mg (0.1 mmol) H6HHTP, 400 μL (0.1mmol) Al(ClO4)3·9H2O (0.25 M in DMF), 400 μL DMF and 200 μL H2O were mixed in a 2 mlTeflon reactor and transferred into the HT reactor.((CH3)2NH2)2[Ga3O(HHTP)(HHTP·)]·14.5H2O: 32.4 mg (0.1 mmol) H6HHTP, 200 ?L(0.1 mmol) Ga(NO3)3·x H2O (0.5 M in DMF), 600 μL DMF and 200 ?L H2O were mixed in a2 ml Teflon reactor and transferred into the HT reactor.The reactors were placed in a conventional oven (forced air circulation) and heated for 48 h at 150 °C. The resulting products were filtrated and washed with DMF, ethanol anddichloromethane. Afterwards the products were redispersed in 1.5 mL dichloromethane andcentrifuged again. This redispersion/centrifugation process was repeated ten times. Due tomoisture and air sensitivity the microcrystalline products were stored in dichloromethane. Forcharacterization samples were dried in air. Both compounds are stable in dichloromethane andunder N2 atmosphere. Synthesis scale-up is possible using the tenfold amounts

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of CAU-43The MOF CAU-43 (1) was synthesized employing a molar ratio of 1:1 for H2FcDC (11.3 mg, 0.0412 mmol) and indium(III) chloride (9.0 mg, 0.0412 mmol). The reactants were placed in a Duran-glass reactor (4 mL) equipped with a stirring bar, and a mixture of water (400 μL) and DMF (400 μL) was added. A scale up of the synthesis could be achieved using H2FcDC (56.5 mg, 0.2060 mmol) and InCl3 (45.0 mg, 0.2050 mmol), water (2.0 mL), and DMF (2.0 mL) in a larger Duran-glass reactor (8 mL). The reactor was heated at 80 °C for 120 min. The brown microcrystalline precipitate was washed with a warm 1:1 water/DMF mixture (10 mL) to remove unreacted linker residue. Afterward, the sample was stirred in 5 mL of MeOH for 36 h (yield: 25.0% based on H2FcDC). Elemental analysis for 1: [In(OH)(FeC12H8O4)]·CH3OH: calc. C 35.8%, H 3.0%; found C 36.3%, H 3.20%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of In-MIL-53-FcDC_aThe MOF In-MIL-53-FcDC_a (2) was synthesized employing H2FcDC (11.3 mg, 0.0412 mmol) and indium(III) nitrate (24.8 mg). The reactants were placed in a Duran-glass reactor (4 mL), and a mixture of water (400 μL) and MeOH (400 μL) was added, along with acetic acid (40 μL). A scale up of the synthesis could be achieved using H2FcDC (56.5 mg, 0.2050 mmol) and In(NO3)3·xH2O (124.0 mg), acetic acid (200 μL, 3.50 mmol), water (2 mL), and MeOH (2 mL) in a larger Duran-glass reactor (8 mL). The reactor was heated at 95 °C for 90 min. The resulting brown single crystals (Figure 1) were carefully washed with hot methanol several times to remove unreacted linker residue. The product was dried in air overnight (yield: 14.4% based on H2FcDC). Elemental analysis for 2: [In(OH)(FeC12H8O4)]: calc. C 35.7%, H 2.3%; found C 35.8%, H 2.6%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of In-FcDCThe coordination polymer In-FcDC (3) was synthesized employing H2FcDC (11.3 mg, 0.0412 mmol) and indium(III) nitrate (12.4 mg). The reactants were placed in a Duran-glass reactor (4 mL) equipped with a stirring bar, and water (800 μL) and acetic acid (20 μL) were added. A scale up of the synthesis could be achieved using H2FcDC (56.5 mg, 0.2060 mmol) and indium(III) nitrate (62 mg), acetic acid (100 μL), and water (4.0 mL) in a larger Duran-glass reactor (8 mL). The reactor was heated at 130 °C for 3 h. After filtration, the brown microcrystalline precipitate was dried in air overnight (yield: 35.0% based on H2FcDC). Elemental analysis for 3: [In(OH)(FeC12H8O4)]: calc. C 35.7%, H 2.3%; found C 36.3%, H 2.4%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Optimized Synthesis of CAU-45: 446.4 mg (2.00 mmol) 5-acetamidoisophthalic acid and 17 mL acetic acid were placed in a PTFE lined steel autoclave. Afterwards 0.892 mL (2.13 mmol) zirconium acetate solution in dilute acetic acid were added and the autoclave was sealed. The mixture was heated to 160 °C in one hour and then the temperature was kept for 22 hours. After the reaction mixture was slowly cooled down to room temperature over 24 h, 525.1 mg of a pale ocher solid were obtained via filtration and subsequent drying for 4 hours at 50 °C (yield: 92 %, based on zirconium and the composition [Zr30O20(OH)26(OAc)18L18]). The real yield will be smaller due to impurities and guest molecules in the pores.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.1 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-10-OCH3. Ga-CAU-10-OCH3 was synthesized under microwave-assisted heating in a 20 ml glass reactor starting from a mixture of 1.5 mL of a 0.72 mol/l aqueous gallium nitrate solution (1.1 mmol), 124.5 mg (0.64 mmol) 5-methoxyisophthalic acid, 13.5 ml toluene and 0.65 ml of a 2 mol/l aqueous NaOH (13 mmol). This mixture was heated at 140 °C for 3 h. After cooling to room temperature the microcrystalline product was isolated by vacuum filtration, washed with 50 ml N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF) and stirred in 15 ml water for 24 h to remove impurities. [Ga(OH)(C9H6O5)] · H2O, C = 36.0 % (calcd 36.2 %) and H = 2.9 % (calcd 3.0 %). Yield: 58.2 mg (18.7 % based on Ga3+).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:During the synthesis optimization, it was possible to isolate single crystals under the following conditions: Ga-CAU-10-OCH3 single crystals were synthesized under conventional heating in a miniaturized 2 ml Teflon reactor starting from a mixture of 0.05 ml of a 0.72 mol/l aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.036 mmol), 8.3 mg 5-methoxyisophthalic acid (0.64 mmol), 0.88 ml toluene and 0.07 ml of a 2 mol/l aqueous NaOH (0.14 mmol). The mixture was heated to 120 °C within 1 h, the temperature was kept for 12 h and cooled down within 6 h to room temperature. The single crystals are shown in Figure S3 of the following section.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.3 Synthesis of Al-CAU-10-NHCOCH3. Al-CAU-10-NHCOCH3 was synthesized under conventional heating in a 20 ml Teflon reactor from a mixture of 0.5 ml of a 1 mol/l aqueous aluminum nitrate solution (0.5 mmol), 223.0 mg 5-acetamideisophthalic acid (0.1 mmol), 9 ml water and 0.5 ml DMF. This mixture was heated at 160 °C for 48 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by centrifugation, washed with 10 ml DMF and stirred in 10 ml water for 24 h to remove impurities. The final product was dried for 24 h at 80 °C under atmospheric conditions. [Al(OH)(C10O5H7N)], C = 44.2 % (calcd 45.3 %), H = 3.7 %(calcd 3.0 %), and N = 6.1 % (calcd 5.3 %). Yield: 67.3 mg (50.8 % based on Al3+).A pH value of pH=3 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.4 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-10-NHCOCH3. Ga-CAU-10-NHCOCH3 was synthesized under microwave-assisted heating in a 20 ml glass reactor from a mixture of an aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 1.0 ml 0.72 mmol), 5-acetamideisophthalic acid (220.4 mg, 0.1 mmol), water (18.6 ml) and NaOH (2 mol/l, 0.4 ml, 0.8mmol). This mixture was heated at 120 °C for 4 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by centrifugation and washed once with 20 ml DMF and twice with ethanol. The final product was dried for 72 h at 80 °C at atmospheric conditions. [Ga(OH)(C10O5H7N)], C = 37.3 % (calcd 38.0 %), H = 2.6 % (calcd 2.9 %) and N = 4.5 % (calcd 4.6 %). Yield: 112 mg (75 % based on Ga3+).A pH value of pH=5 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.5 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-11A typical reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.9 ml, 0.65 mmol), H2SDBS (186 mg, 0.6 mmol) and water (9.1 ml). All materials were placed in a 20 ml glass reactor and heated at 120 °C for 2 h in a microwave oven. After cooling to room temperature and vacuum filtration the white powder was stirred for 2 h in 15 ml DMF, vacuum filtrated, washed with 50 ml ethanol and dried at 160 °C. [Ga(OH)(C14H8O6S)], C = 42.6 % (calcd 43.0 %), H = 2.5 % (calcd 2.3 %) and S = 8.6 % (calcd 8.2 %). Yield: 65.4 mg (26.0 % based on Ga3+).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.6 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-11-COOH. Ga-CAU-11-COOH was synthesized in a 20 ml Teflon reactor starting from a reaction mixture which contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.5 ml, 0.36 mmol), DPSTC (179.1 mg, 0.5 mmol), water (8.75 ml), NaOH (2 mol/l, 0.65 ml, 1.3 mmol) and concentrated acetic acid (0.5 ml, 8.7mmol). The reactor was placed in a steel autoclave and heated in a ventilation oven at 180 °C for 24 h. After cooling to room temperature, the product was isolated by filtration and washed with 50 ml of N,N'-DMF, 50 ml of ethanol and dried for 2 h at 80 °C. [Ga(OH)(C16H8O10S)], C = 39.6 % (calcd 40.1 %), H = 1.9 % (calcd 1.9 %) and S = 6.7 % (calcd 6.7 %). Yield: 135 mg (77.0 % based on Ga3+).The pH value of the reaction mixture changed from pH = 5 to pH = 3 during the reaction.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.7 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-49. Ga-CAU-49 was obtained in miniaturized 2 ml Teflon reactors. A reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.1 ml, 0.07 mmol), 5-metylisophthlaic acid (9.1 mg, 0.05 mmol), toluene (0.425 ml), water (0.425 ml) and acetic acid (4 mol/l, 0.05 ml, 0.2 mmol). The reaction was carried out at 120 °C for 24 h. The resulting white solid was filtered off, stirred for 1 h in 15 ml DMF, washed with water and dried at 80 °C. [Ga4(C9H7O4)2(C9H6O4)3(OH)4(H2O)] · 0.5 Ga2O3, C = 41.1 %(calcd 40.0 %) and H = 3.1 % (calcd 2.8 %). 10.2 mg (2 % based on m-BDC-CH32-ions).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.During the synthesis optimization, it was possible to isolate single crystals, which were obtained under the conditions described above.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:2.8 Synthesis of Ga-CAU-51A typical reaction mixture contained aqueous gallium nitrate solution (0.72 mol/l, 0.05 ml, 0.036 mmol), 2,5-thiophenedicarboxylic acid (8.6 mg, 0.05 mmol) in 1 ml of a 80:20 vol% solution of concentrated acetic acid and water. All chemicals were placed in a 4 ml glass reactor and heated at 120 °C for 4 h in a microwave oven. The resulting white powder was isolated by centrifugation, treated for 24 h in 4 ml methanol and dried at 80 °C after filtration. [Ga(OH)(C6O4H2S)] · 2 H2O, C = 24.9 % (calcd 24.6 %), H = 1.7 % (calcd 2.4 %) and S = 11.0 % (calcd 11.0 %). Yield: 2.7 mg (22 % based on Ga3+ ions).A pH value of pH=2 of the reaction mixture before and after the reaction was measured.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Syntheses of the title compounds. The title compounds werefirst synthesized using our high-throughput setup19 by adding 30 μL (0.03 mmol, c = 1 mol L-1) of an aqueous solution of therespective metal nitrate (Al3+, Ga3+ or Fe3+) to a mixture of1,1,2,2-tetrakis(4-phosphonophenyl)ethylene (0.015 mmol,9.8 mg) and 970 μL H2O. After sealing the multiclave, the reac tion was carried out using the temperature-time-program ofheating up to 180 °C within one hour and keeping the reactiontemperature for 12 h at 180 °C. After cooling to room tempera ture, the product was isolated by filtration and rinsed threetimes with 2 mL of water and finally dried under ambient con ditions. All three compounds were obtained as microcrystal line powders.Results of the elemental analyses (observed/calculated):Al-CAU-53, [Al2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·2H2O:C 40.5/40.4, H 3.99/3.39Ga-CAU-53, [Ga2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·2H2O:C 36.7/36.4, H 3.15/3.06Fe-CAU-53, [Fe2(H2O)2(H2TPPE)]·3H2O:C 36.9/36.8, H 3.53/3.33

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis scale-up of Ga-CAU-53 and Fe-CAU-53. Although ascaled-up synthesis of Al-CAU-53 was not feasible, the follow ing procedure was used to obtain larger amounts of Ga- andFe-CAU-53. Applying the same procedure to the Al-CAU-53 syn thesis, only X-ray amorphous products were obtained.1,1,2,2-Tetrakis(4-phosphonophenyl)-ethylene (0.15 mmol,97.9 mg) and an aqueous solution of gallium nitrate or ironnitrate (0.3 mmol, 300 μL, 1 mol L-1) were added to 9.7 mLwater placed in a 30 mL Teflon insert. The same temperature time-program as described above was used. The precipitatewas filtered off and washed with 15 mL water. In case of Ga CAU-53, 96.8 mg (0.113 mmol, 75.2%) of a white-yellowishpowder was obtained. Fe-CAU-53 was obtained as yellowpowder (100 mg, 0.118 mmol, 78.9%).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:SYNTHESIS OF COMPOUNDSZIF-20: Zn(Pur)2·(DMF)0.75 (H2O)1.5. A solid mixture of zinc nitratetetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (65 mg, 0. 25 mmol, EM Science) and purine(150 mg, 1.25 mmol, Fluka or Sigma) was dissolved in 5 ml DMF (Fisher) in a20 ml vial to obtain a slightly turbid solution. The vial was tightly capped andheated at 65 °C in an isothermal oven for 3 days to yield pale yellow octahedralcrystals along with a small amount of powder. After unassisted cooling of thevial to room temperature, the powder product was removed by decanting withmother liquor and washed three times with DMF (5 ml). The crystals weredried in air for 30 min (yield: 48 mg, 50% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:ZIF-21: Co(Pur)2·(DMF)(H2O). A solid mixture of cobalt(II) nitratehexahydrate Co(NO3)2·6H2O (146 mg, 0.502 mmol, Aldrich) and purine(300 mg, 2.50 mmol) was dissolved in DMF (5 ml) in a 20 ml vial. To thesolution, 2.0 M dimethylamine solution in methanol (1.25 ml, 2.50 mmol,Aldrich) was added. The vial was tightly capped and heated at 85 °C in anisothermal oven for 24 h to yield purple octrahedral crystals. After unassistedcooling of the vial to room temperature, the mother liquor was decanted andthe crystals were rinsed three times with DMF (5 ml) and dried in air for 1 h(yield: 92 mg, 47% based on Co(NO3 )2·6H2O).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:ZIF-22: Zn(5-Azabenzimidazolato)2·(DMF)0.75 (H2O)2. A solid mixture ofzinc nitrate tetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (52 mg, 0.20 mmol) and5-azabenzimidazole (238 mg, 2.00 mmol, Aldrich) was dissolved in 2 ml DMFin a 4 ml vial to obtain a white precipitate. The vial was tightly capped andheated at 150 °C in an isothermal oven for 3 days to yield pale yellow octahedralcrystals along with a small amount of powder. After unassisted cooling of thevial to room temperature, the powder product was removed by decanting withmother liquor and rinsed three times with DMF (4 mlx3). The crystals weredried in air for 30 min (yield: 68 mg, 87% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:ZIF-23: Zn(4-Azabenzimidazolato)2·(H2O)0.25. A solid mixture of zinc nitratetetrahydrate Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (52 mg, 0.20 mmol) and 4-azabenzimidazole(119 mg, 1.00 mmol, Aldrich) was dissolved in 1 ml DMF in a 4 ml vial. The vialwas tightly capped and heated at 100 °C in an isothermal oven for 1 day to yieldpale yellow prism crystals. After unassisted cooling of the vial to roomtemperature, the crystals were rinsed three times with DMF (5 ml) and dried inair for 30 min (yield: 55 mg, 90% based on Zn(NO3 )2·4H2O). The sameproduct was obtained in reactions at different temperatures (65 and 150 °C), atwhich ZIF-20 and ZIF-22 were synthesized, respectively. Reaction with adifferent ligand/metal ratio (1:10, instead of 1:5) as used in the synthesis ofZIF-21 also gave the same compound..

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:(ZIF-2 crb): Zn(IM)2. 0.18 mL imidazole stock solution (0.15 M (1 M = 1 mol dm-3), 2.7 × 10-5 mol) and 0.12 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.15 M, 1.8 × 10-5 mol) were mixed together. After the glass plate was loaded with mixtures of stock solutions dispensed by a programmed liquid handler (Gilson, model 215), it was covered with a PTFE sheet, sealed by fastening the sheet with a metal clamp, then heated in an oven at 85 °C and allowed to react solvothermally for 72 h. The product was in the form of prism-shaped single crystals. The unit cell dimensions of the ZIF thus obtained match with the unit cell dimensions of ZIF-2 previously reported.

Yield: 0.0145 g, 63 % based on 4-hydroxymethyl-5-methylimidazole.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Bulk scale synthesis of (ZIF-78 gme): Zn(nIm)(nbIm). 5 mL 2-nitroimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) and 5 mL 5-nitro benzimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) were mixed in a 20 mL vial. To this solution was added 4 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.20 M). The vial was capped and heated to 100 °C for 96 h. The mother liquor was decanted and the precipitate was washed with DMF (15 mL) three times. Yellow crystals of ZIF-78 were collected by filtration and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.060 g, 28%).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Bulk scale synthesis of (ZIF-79 gme): Zn(nIm)(mbIm). 5 mL 2-nitroimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) and 5 mL 5-methylbenzimidazole stock solution (0.20 M) were mixed in a 20 mL vial. To this solution was added 4 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.20 M). The vial was capped and heated to 85 °C for 96 h. The mother liquor was decanted and the products were washed with DMF (15 mL) three times. Yellow crystals of ZIF-79 were collected by filtration and dried in air (10 min) (yield: 0.030 g, 14%)

To this solution was added 4 mL Zn(NO3)2·4H2O stock solution (0.20 M). The vial was capped and heated to 90 °C for 96 h. Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Solvothermal procedureSingle crystals of ZIF-90 were obtained by heating a solution of zinc nitrate tetrahydrate (Zn(NO3)2·4H2O) (0.054 g, 0.21 mmol) and imidazole-2-carboxyaldehyde (0.029 g, 0.30 mmol) in N,N-dimethylformamide (DMF, 3 mL) for 18 h at 100 °C.Vapor diffusionZinc nitrate tetrahydrate (Zn(NO3)2·4H2O) (0.13 g, 0.50 mmol) and imidazole-2-carboxyaldehyde (0.07 g, 0.75 mmol) in DMF (10 mL) was placed in a desiccator under an atmosphere of triethylamine (5 mL) in hexane (200 mL). The reaction was allowed to sit at room temperature for 24 h. The crystalline powder obtained was filtered and washed with methanol (3 x 5 mL). The product was activated with methanol (3 x 10 mL) over a three-day period before being dried under vacuum (10-2 Torr) for 24 h at room temperature. Yield (0.08 g, 61.5%) CHN calculated for C8H6N4O2Zn: C, 37.60; H, 2.37; N, 21.92% Found: C, 37.63; H, 2.76; N, 20.48%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of ZIF-202, Cu2Zn(Im)4A mixture of Zn(OAc)2·2H2O (0.052 g, 0.24 mmol) and [Cu(HIm)4](NO3)2 (0.092 g, 0.20 mmol) was dissolved using a solvent mixture of DMF/water/MeOH (2/1/1, v/v). The pH of the solution mixture was adjusted to ca. 5.4 by addition of acetic acid. The solution mixture was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube. The tube was flash frozen at 77 K using a liquid N2 bath, evacuated for 15 min to remove oxygen, and then flame-sealed to maintain a oxygen-free environment inside the tube during the reaction process. After the sealed reaction tube was heated at 85 °C for 4 d, truncated colorless crystals were obtained. The crystals were subsequently collected and washed with DMF, water, and MeOH (3 × 2 mL, each) before SXRD analysis. For the activation procedure, as-synthesized ZIF-202 was washed five times with DMF per day (5 mL each), exchanged nine times with anhydrous MeOH (5 mL each) over the course of 3 d, and then activated at 80 °C under reduced pressure (1 mTorr) for 24 h. Yield: 65% based on copper imidazole complex. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu2ZnC12H12N8 = Cu2Zn(Im)4: C, 31.28; H, 2.63; N, 24.32%. Found: C, 31.29; H, 2.54; N, 24.10%. ICP-OES of activated sample (2.0 mg of ZIF-202 in 10 mL of HNO3 (1.68 M)): Cu, 4.531 ppm; Zn, 2.338 ppm. FT-IR (KBr, 3500–400 cm–1): 3144 (w), 3112 (w), 1699 (w), 1654 (w), 1614 (m), 1486 (s), 1465 (s), 1316 (m), 1275 (m), 1236 (m), 1172 (s), 1114 (w), 1085 (vs), 985 (w), 955 (s), 846 (w), 828 (s), 766 (s), 663 (s), 645 (w).

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of ZIF-203, Cu3Zn2(Im)10·3H2OA mixture of Zn(OAc)2·2H2O (0.052 g, 0.24 mmol) and [Cu(HIm)4](NO3)2 (0.14 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 4 mL of MeCN. The pH of solution mixture was adjusted to 8.5 by addition of TBAOH. The solution mixture was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube. The flame-sealed tube was prepared in the same way as ZIF-202, which was left at room temperature for 6 d. Several single crystals of ZIF-203 were obtained on the walls of the sealed tube and were collected for SXRD analysis. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu3Zn2C30H36N20O3 = Cu3Zn2(Im)10·3H2O: C, 34.44; H, 3.47; N, 26.78%. Found: C, 34.51; H, 3.17; N, 26.49%. The pH of solution mixture was adjusted to 8.5 through the addition of TBAOH. The solution was then introduced to a borosilicate glass tube, and the flame-sealed tube was prepared in the same way as ZIF-203. Microcrystalline powder was obtained after allowing the sealed reaction vessel to sit for 14 d at room temperature. This powder was then collected and washed with DMF, water, and acetonitrile (3 x 2 mL, each). Several single crystals of ZIF-204 were obtained on the wall of the sealed tubes, which were used for SXRD analysis. For the activation procedure, as-synthesized ZIF-204 was washed five times with DMF per day (5 mL each), exchanged nine times with anhydrous MeOH over the course of 3 d (5 mL each), and then activated at 80 °C under reduced pressure (1 mTorr) for 24 h. Yield: 60% based on Zn(OAc)2·2H2O. EA of activated sample: Calcd for Cu3Zn2C30H30N20 = Cu3Zn2(Im)10: C, 36.32; H, 3.05; N, 28.23%. Found: C, 35.86; H, 2.87; N, 27.74%. ICP-OES of activated sample (5.21 mg of ZIF-204 in 10 mL of HNO3 (1.68 M)): Cu, 10.12 ppm; Zn, 7.15 ppm. FT-IR (KBr, 3500-400 cm-1): 3132 (w), 3015 (w), 2359 (w), 1758 (w), 1716 (w), 1592 (m), 1489 (w), 1474 (m), 1365 (w), 1319 (w), 1239 (m), 1217 (w), 1168 (m), 1084 (s), 974 (w), 951 (s), 836 (m), 750 (s), 666 (s), 623 (w).

In a sealed tube (typeA, company: Ace) 0.018 g (0.22 mmol) of 2-methylimidazole(L1), 0.031 g (0.22 mmol) of 2-trifluoromethylimidazole (L2),and 0.059 g of Zn(NO3)2·4H2O (0.22 mmol) were dissolved in3 mL of N,N'-diethylformamide (DEF). The sealed tube wasclosed and the mixture was heated at 135 °C for 48 hours andwas then allowed to cool down to room temperature with 5 °Cper hour. Light brown color crystals were washed with DEF andEtOH and dried in air. Under the same conditions with DMFsolvent, light yellow crystals of ZIF-318 were also formed butwith ZnO impurities. Single X-ray crystallographic measure ment was done using the crystals, obtained under the same re action conditions in DMF because of good diffraction quality(see ESI?). Yield for ZIF-318: 0.031 g (48.7% based on Zn?NO3)2·4H2O); IR (KBr pellet): vmax = 3458 (m), 2931 (m), 1678 (s),1581 (vs), 1461 (s), 1371 (s), 1309 (s), 1277 (s), 1226 (vs), 1185(vs), 1144 (vs), 1098 (s), 1003 (vs), 954 (s), 828 (s), 745 cm?1 (vs)

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:For the synthesis of [Zn(im)2·0.5py]-neb, a solution of 1.36 g(20.0 mmol) imidazole in 30 mL (0.51 mmol) of EtOH is poured intoa solution of 1.82 g (8.30 mmol) of Zn(OAc)2·2H2O in 30 mL (0.37mmol) of pyridine. A voluminous amorphous solid forms instantaneouslyupon mixing. The resultant mixture has the molar ratio Zn/Him/py/EtOH = 1: 2.4: 45: 62. The mixture is stirred at room temperaturefor 24 h. Thereafter, the white solid is recovered by filtration,washed with EtOH and dried. The yield is 62% based on Zn. Thematerial is a pure phase according to powder XRD. TG traces measuredin a flow of air reveal a first mass loss of 18% between 120 and220 °C corresponding to the escape of pyridine (calc. 18%) and asecond mass loss of 49% between 400 and 750 °C corresponding tothe oxidative decomposition of [Zn(im)2] into ZnO (calc. 48%). Variable-temperature powder XRD patterns demonstrate frameworkcollapse at temperatures between 120 and 220 °C with formation of[Zn(im)2]-coi at temperatures above 120 °C and, subsequently, formationof [Zn(im)2]-zni and an amorphous phase at temperaturesabove 220 °C.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:For the synthesis of [Zn(im)2·0.5mor]-neb, a solution of 0.47 g(6.86 mmol) of imidazole in 10 mL (0.17 mmol) of EtOH is pouredinto a suspension of 1.02 g (3.43 mmol) Zn(NO3)2·6H2O in 15 mL (0.17mmol) of morpholine. The resultant gelatinous mixture has themolar ratio Zn/Him/mor/EtOH = 1: 2: 50: 50. The mixture is stirred atroom temperature for 24 h and then heated in an oil bath to 140 °C for 4 h under continuous stirring. After cooling to room temperature,the colorless crystals are recovered by filtration, washed with EtOHand dried. The yield is 83% based on Zn. The material is a pure phaseaccording to powder XRD. TG traces measured in a flow of air reveala first mass loss of 17% between 150 and 320 °C corresponding tothe escape of morpholine (calc. 17%) and a second mass loss of 49%between 320 and 700 °C corresponding to the oxidative decompositionof [Zn(im)2] into ZnO (calc. 50%). Variable-temperature powderXRD patterns demonstrate framework collapse at a temperature ofapproximately 240 °C with formation of [Zn(im)2]-zni.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-1(sod): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.267 g, 1.0 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.410 g, 5.0 mmol) dissolved in 15 mL n-butanol was placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 120 °C for 24 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless (or pale yellow) crystals were washed with ethanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 55%);

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-2(mer): a) synthesis of the single crystal for X-ray diffraction. a mixture of cadmium nitrate tetrahydrate (0.154 g, 0.5 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.0821 g, 1.0 mmol) in N-methyl-pyrrolidione (NMP) (5 mL) was placed in a 10 mL trial that was stirred until all starting materials dissolved. This vial was inserted in a larger vial containing another 10 mL vial filled with triethylamine (0.2 mL) and the NMP (5 mL). The larger vial was sealed and left undisturbed for about two weeks to crystallize. The colorless crystal was selected for single crystal analysis;

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:b) synthesis of bulk sample of CdIF-2: to A mixture of cadmium nitrate tetrahydrate (1.109 g, 3.6 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.591 g, 7.2 mmol) in N-methyl-pyrrolidione (NMP) (30 mL), 10 mL NMP containing 1.0 mL triethylamine was added under stirring at room temperature in ca. 2 hours. Then, the reactant mixture was left stirring at room temperature for anther 46 hours. The white participate was filtered and left to air-dry, yielding ca. 0.45 g white powder that was confirmed to be CdIF-2 for its XRD similar to that simulated from the corresponding single crystal date.However, as a large amount of NMP was evacuated from the framework of CdIF-2, its structural integrity had been lost and finally became to amorphous solid.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-3 (yqt1): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.267 g, 1.0 mmol) and 2-methylimidazole (0.410 g, 5.0 mmol) dissolved in 15 mL methanol were placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 90 °C for 24 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless crystals were washed with ethanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 50%);

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-4 (rho): A mixture of cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.534 g, 2.0 mmol) and 2-ethylimidazole (0.961 g, 10.0 mmol) dissolved in 20 mL methanol was placed in a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. The reactant mixture was heated at 120 °C for 12 hours and then cooled to room temperature. After separation by filtering, colorless (or pale yellow) crystals were washed with methanol (3 x 10 mL) and evacuated in vacuum at room temperature (yield 60 %);

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-6 (ana): A mixture of Cd(CH3COO)2·2H2O (0.267g, 1 mmol), Heim (0.192 g, 2 mmol), anhydrous piperazine (0.084 g, 1 mmol) were added to ethanol (20 mL), and after being stirred for 12 hours, this heterogeneous mixture was placed into a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 60 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-4 (rho) mixed with CdIF-6 (ana) were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 100 °C for 20 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-7β (dia): A mixture of Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O (0.0209g, 0.05 mmol), Hnim (0.0113 g, 0.1 mmol) and DMF (8 mL) was placed into a 15 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 72 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-7β (dia) (C12H8N12O8Cd2?0.25DMF) mixed with CdIF-9 (rho) were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-8 (sod): A mixture of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.192g, 0.625 mmol), Hnim (0.1425 g, 1.25 mmol) and DMF (15 mL) was placed into a 15 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 120 °C for 12 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-8 were separated by filtration. X-ray single crystal analysis reveals a zeolitic sodalite-like structure and XRD spectrum for the bulk sample is agreeable to that simulated from the X-ray single crystal data. However, as CdIF-8 was washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and evacuated in vacuum, its zeolitic sodalite structure was destroyed.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:CdIF-9 (rho): A mixture of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.192g, 0.625 mmol), Hnim (0.1425 g, 1.25 mmol) and DMA (15 mL) was placed into a 20 mL Teflon-lined autoclave. Then, the autoclave was sealed and heated at 100 °C for 12 hours. After being cooled to ambient room temperature, the autoclave was opened and colorless crystals of CdIF-9 were separated by filtration, washed with methanol (10 mL x3) and dried in air.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of Co-ZIF-81 [C10H5Br2CoN5O2. Paragraph_2_reaction_time:The typical synthesis of TIF-1Zn: Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (118.8mg), 5,6-dimethyl-benzimidazole (157.6mg), (±)-2-amino-1-butanol (4.0mL) and benzene(3.2mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for half an hour. The autoclave was then sealed and heated at 150 °C for 5 days, followed by cooling to room temperature. A large amount of colorless crystals were obtained with a yield of 43.2% (based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed using ethanol three times and dried in air for other measurements. IR data for as-synthesized TIF-1Zn (KBr, cm-1): 1475s, 1337m, 1203m, 1167w,1093w, 1021w, 848m, 813w, 648w. The synthesis of TIF-1Co is similar with that of TIF-1Zn, except for the replacement of the Zn(Ac)2·2H2O by Co(Ac)2·4H2O. A large amount of violet powder was obtained with a yield of 39.2%.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of TIF-2. Zn(Ac)2·2H2O (117.8 mg, 0.5367mmol),5-methylbenzimidazole (70.3 mg, 0.5320mmol), imidazole (44.2mg, 0.6492mmol), ()-2-amino-1-butanol (4.0 mL), and benzene(3.6 mL) are mixed in a Teflon-lined autoclave and stirred for 0.5 h.The autoclave was then sealed and heated up at 150 °C for 5 days,followed by cooling down to room temperature. A large amountof small colorless crystalline materials were obtained with a yieldof 35.4% (based on zinc salt). The crystals were washed usingethanol three times and dried in air for other measurements.Elemental analysis of as-synthesized sample: C, 49.22; H, 4.02;N, 20.98. Elemental analysis of sample dried at 300 °C: C, 47.93;H, 3.78; N, 20.78.

Paragraph_2_reaction_time:Synthesis of TIF-3.
